Breakfast was HEAVILY attended - so when setting your departure time, be sure to tack on extra time to account for the lines at breakfast and the line to get your valet parked car. Location was great, we walked to a Padres game and it was reasonable. Also walked around the harbor and the Seaside Village across the street. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chelstin
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, awesome bay view. The manager's reception was better than I have seen before at an Embassy Suites. The valet service was a hassle but seemed to work okay. St. Louis Ribs right down the street was a great place to eat and a short walk. The best place that the kids enjoyed the most was Corvette Diner-- try the Rory- a hamburger with peanut butter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, but must pay for parking”
Reviews.Author: mojo6170
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, beautiful rooms, delicious breakfast--location is great, can walk, take public transportation including the trolly, bus or ferry just about anywhere you want to go. This is a plus, because the hotel charges $20/day for parking. We chose not to rent a car, since the fee for parking just wasn't worth it for us. If you do want to rent a car for a day trip you can easily take the trolly to Little Italy where there are many rental cars available. You can do many sight-seeing trips around San Diego on foot, or public transportation. This was a fun vacation--and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Elizabeth and Lindsey at the front desk are the best!”
Reviews.Author: SteveinBako
Reviews.Content: Stayed in late July for business and family vacation (Comic Con). We have stayed several times at this hotel. When we arrived late (around 11pm) we were greeted by Elizabeth. She woked with us to make sure our two reservations (one I booked, one booked though SD travel and visitors bureau Comic Con again). Elizabeth gor our rooms worked out. We got the upgrade to the two bedroom suite worked out. She did this all with a smile on her face! Warm greeting by the bellman staff and parking attendante as well. When I neded some small items like info, coins for the laundry machines and when my wife lost her breakfast coupon card, Lindsey was always ready to help. When we left after 6 days, our bellman (forgot his name) was again smiling and helped us load up our many items and got them to the car which the parking staff had waiting for us when we got downstairs. Overall, the best experiece I have ever had. Only one problem. When we checked in the shower head was disconnted in the master bath. We called down the next morning and they have it repaired on the spot! One other concern. I booked the room again for next year. The best rate I could get was $695 for a basic suite. I booked it, but feel a little taken advantage of. But, that has nothing to do with the overall experience. Thanks Elizabeth and Lindsey!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Piaget18
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd Embassy Suites stay in my life. I did not expect anything spectacular and anything bad, just a good reasonable comfortable stay with free breakfast. All of my expectations were met. I was able to check in early (before noon) and was given a balcony room by a nice front desk clerk. Only bad thing about the balcony room is that your next door neigbor also have a balcony and can see directly into your bed so you may have to use the privacy curtain. But I will take a balcony room anyday over the standard room. The room overall was typical of Embassy Suites with comfortable bed, roomy seating area with fridge and microwave. Room was pretty clean except the doors to the balcony were little dirty with a lot of fingerprints. I went down to eat breakfast at 7AM (thanks to still on the Eastern time zone). On the menu: Omelettes, scrambled eggs, home fries, bacon, pancakes, yogurt, apple, banana, pastries, cereals, coffee, milk and juices. The qaulity is okay and more than satisfactory for a "complimentary" breakfast. The dining area staff were always pleasant except the omelette station cooks who are pokerfaced, probably due to the pressure to move the lines quickly. Talking about the lines, between 7 - 8:30AM appears to be the best time. After that, I noticed the lines got really long for both the omelette and the hot food stations. The manager's reception also brought a long line to the bar. I only grabbed popcorn which was good. I didn't see any hot food items like chicken wings. Location was great as a tourist. You are a few blocks away from the trolley lines and the Seaport Village which I enjoyed for food (except for the price of a Hagaan Daaz milk shake, $8!!). I debated staying more towards downtown (Westin) but I much prefer this location as unless you are right on Gaslamp Quarters area, the other downtown locations are pretty dead and don't really have things to do or character based on my observations. Gaslamp area is very busy with a lot of restaurants/bars, if that is your style. I didn't check out the pool so no comment on that. This area seemed safe with some upscale looking residential condos in the area. I would definately stay here again. Things to note: The commuter train noise some of the reviewers are complaining is overrated. Unless you are really sensitive to noise, it won't bother you. I hate to pay for parking. I rented a car the last day of my stay and found a street parking couple of blocks away for overnight. I just had to feed the meeter at 8am (I think it has a 3 hour limit). I didn't really see restaurants around this area except in the Seaport Village which is nearby. Taxi from airport is about $12 - $13. I enjoyed San Diego Zoo, Balboa Park, Coronado beach. Seaworld was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: nomowurk
Reviews.Content: Visited last week for three days. One day room never cleaned . Need more help clearing tables for the breakfast . I know whybtheyboffer free wi fi . It didn't work . I was surprised when I saw ear plugs next to the bed . Then realized that trains run 24 hours a day . Horns . Bells . GREAT LOCATION . Could walk to all the areas activities ... I would recommend only after telling them my story

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but very nice & great location”
Reviews.Author: Sometimestravler
Reviews.Content: The front desk personnel were efficient. The breakfast (included with the cost of the room) is well above the usual hotel breakfast. The location was great. I could walk to Seaport Village, restaurants, the Midway, along the bay, etc. I selected a room on the bay side on an upper level floor which had a great view and no train noise. (The train tracks are nearby on the opposite side of the hotel.) Downsides: the cost and no airport transportation. If you have a car, the space is very tight for loading & off loading and they charge for the parking. I recommend the hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel right in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfayn
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Embassy Suites. As other travelers have mentioned, the breakfast is great and so was the manager's reception. Our room was a nice size with plenty of room for two adults and three teenagers. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. The valet parking is outrageous, $29 a night. I understand that they must use valet parking due to the lack of space, but I think around $20 a night would have been much easier to swallow. The manager who checked us in flinched when he told us how much it was, I think he had been yelled at for it before. The only other drawback was the fact that they only offer handicap accessible rooms with one king bed, there are none in the hotel with two queens or doubles. I have a disabled 14 year old who was unable to shower the entire four nights we were there. This situation really needs to be remedied. I would love to be able to stay at an Embassy Suites again but we won't if this is the standard situation for this brand.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, included breakfast and 2 hr free happy hour”
Reviews.Author: PRESCOTTAZ
Reviews.Content: Location within walking distance of Convention Center and Gaslamp District. Nice suite with large separate sitting and bedroom with 2 televions. Refrig for snacks and microwave for our use. Be sure to ask the cooks for the cook to order omelets - very good. Only con was the food at the on-site restaurant - awful. One of the worst crab cakes I have ever had. Instead walk across street to the Harbor House restaurant for wonderful seafood and a 2 million dollar view. Will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Your average Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: jguillet
Reviews.Content: The location is great - walking distance to just about everything. A bit far for a walk to the Gaslamp District if you're out of shape. Breakfast was good, but very crowded and a bit confusing. Hot eggs and omelets on the left, ot tray items on the right. Drinks in the back. $39 per day parking?!? No other options. Factor that in, plus this easy walking location, when deciding to rent a car. We would have saved by using a cab to/from the airport. The room had broken door handles on furniture and was a little "used". I've had better and worse. Just average. BTW, I'm a Hilton Honors Gold member.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: JRO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I tend to stay with the Hilton hotel family when not seeking out a B&B, and as such have stayed in several Embassy's. They are usually a good deal in that the accommodations are spacious, the beds are always comfortable, you are offered a full, hot breakfast, and it's nice to relax with a glass of wine or cocktail in the afternoon - and all of this is included in the upfront price. This particular hotel excelled with customer service, the pool/hot tub area, Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries, and especially, the location. It's across the street from the waterfront, a block or so from the USS Midway and touring boats, a couple of blocks from the convention center and the Gaslamp district, and a very short drive to Petco/Padres stadium. There are many restaurants right at the front door. The hotel common areas are lovely. The only two negatives that I have is that some of the inroom furniture has seen better days. They may be in the process of replacing it, though, as there appears to be brand new pieces mixed in among the battle weary. The other is that housekeeping is just adequate. One day we were left only one wash cloth, another day there was no bar soap. They kept everything very clean, but the lack of attention here was annoying. It certainly isn't a deal breaker, just some useful info to notice before you settle in for the evening. On a positive note for inroom thoughtfulness - they provide earplugs by the bed in case "city sounds" are something to which you are not unaccustomed. Nice touch -

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Every Need Was Met!”
Reviews.Author: dburrescia
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough of this hotel, the room was spotless. Good Coffee in the room, spacious, bed was great. If your wife is using one sink to get ready, there's another for you to use. The morning breakfast is great omelets made to order. Starbucks in the building if you desire. Happy Hour does not let you down, well drinks and beer for free, you can't go wrong. And a bar attached to the building for a night cap. All around great experience. ONE THING I thought was kind of a ridiculous was the $29.00 per night fee to park your car. But they have you by the .... , there's no other place to park your car in the area. FYI Secret Tip I figured out. Buy a coffee at Starbucks, Ask for the Wi-Fi Code, take a picture of the paper they give you and use the Wi-Fi for FREE the whole time you're there!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but for the price it should be better”
Reviews.Author: Alicia_714
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family for the second part of the trip. The valet was expensive the lobby was good. The breakfast was amazing! The happy hour was amazing! The pool was good, but crowded! There was not free Wifi, but you could use the internet downstairs to print my museum and tour tickets! The location was the greatest! However the room was not cleaned well, but we dealt with the front desk and the fixed the problem! The view from our window was lovely! This is a pretty good price, but a little pricey. The rooms are really large and that is something you got to love! Plus you have a microwave, fridge, and extra sinks in the room so it is good to save the leftovers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: JohnroFlorida
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego a few weeks ago and used credit card points for my stay here. Excellent property and location. I have stayed at several Embassy Suites before and all expectations were met and surpassed. Excellent staff and everyone that I encountered was so helpful. If you had a request they not only fulfilled the request but went out of their way to do something a little extra for you. I had requested an early check-in and was accommodate. Of course, I was very pleased with that but then as an added bonus the front desk told me that breakfast was still going on for a few minutes and feel free to get something. That night I asked directions to the trolley. The guy at the front desk not only gave me directions but gave me options for going to old town and the advantages of which train station to use. Again, I was wowed. Hat's off to their excellent customer service and really going out of their way to help the customer and make their guests feel important. Great rooms and the breakfast as usual was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! I will definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: CarmenXO
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The staff was awesome and provided great customer service! Breakfast was delicious and complimentary happy hour was even better!

Reviews.Title: “Typical great stay at Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: twins5300
Reviews.Content: We couldn't get into the hotel where the conference was at the first two nights and got a room here. I have always had wonderful stays at ES and the full breakfast in the moring is the best! We got lucky and our room had a little balcony (not all of them do). The room was perfect with upscale furniture and marble baths. The only flaw was the additional toilet paper holder started coming out of the wall. A perk was that Starbucks was on the first floor and a little restaurant with outdoor seating. The pool was indoors and had a small outdoor area too but no great view. The location is directly across from Seaport Village (a great tourist attraction but $$$ to eat at). We walked all around and even the several blocks to The Gaslamp District. I am a sunbather so to me the only flaw is that it had a indoor pool. Otherwise if you are here for business you won't be disappointed. The water is just a block away as well as many attractions. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Very good accomodations, great location”
Reviews.Author: A_guy_from_Texas
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly and courteous staff, overall I liked it and would return. My only complaint is that valet parking is required at a rate $12.99 per night (they did charge me for 1 night less than we actually stayed).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great perks!”
Reviews.Author: Limabeanmom2003
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay. This hotel is located so close to the waterfront. It's an easy walk to the USS Midway, historical ships and Maritime Museum. You can also walk from here to the gas lamp quarter and petco park in about 10-15 minutes. The free breakfast was great! Made to order omelettes, French toast, pan cakes, eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, oatmeal with toppings, fresh fruit, pastries, yogurt, juices, milk, coffee, toast, bagels. The evening reception snacks were nothing special. Just pretzels, frigid and snack mix. One night I noticed they added nacho chips with salsa and cheese. But really, everyone is there for the free beer, wine and cocktails! Pool area is very nice. The pool is indoors and there is a hot tub right outside. There is an ice cream vending machine in the pool area. There is a starbucks on property, open 6am-6pm. There is also an restaurant on property too. Food there was good, but if you want a good meal head over to the gas lamp district. We ate at sammy's wood fired pizzas...very yummy! I think I left my sunglasses there though:(. But I digress.... This hotel is a very short drive to the airport. Maybe 10 minutes. In fact you could walk there if you wanted to. I went for a run one morning from the hotel to the airport along the waterfront. Very pedestrian friendly. I knew about the parking fee ahead of time, so I was expecting the expense. But with the free breakfast alone we saved over $30 a day, so that wasn't so bad. Disappointed that there was no free wifi in rooms. They do have computers in the lobby that you can use for free.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but there are other choices”
Reviews.Author: AmyMR
Reviews.Content: If you care about connecting to the internet, this place isn't for you. Connectivity is terrible and they want you to pay for this service! Also, the sofa bed is uncomfortable. Most are, but several upscale hotels have upgraded to nicer pullouts. The breakfast is fantastic, though. And if you do stay here, it is a short walk to the Seaport Village for restaurants and stores - really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: PhxGurlAZ
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a night at this hotel. We absolutely loved it. Everything was great, the early check-in, the nice, clean spacious room, the $9 upgrade, the free breakfast, the free evening reception, the business center, and the short travel to the Gaslamp District. We will definitely be coming back. The service was great, from the front desk persons to the valet. Our only complaint would be the concierge. She was very unhelpful and a lil rude. We didn't get much information from her. We just googled points of interest and were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT leave ANY valuables in your car...They WILL be gone"”
Reviews.Author: MStraveller26
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family for a fun San Diego sea world weekend. We had no choice of parking the car ourselves. It was all valet. Took the kids to sea world in the morning then came back for a little siesta and thought I'd leave my stuff in the car since we were planning to return back in a couple of hours(Idiot) for the evening show. so I gave the valet my keys and then when I returned a couple of hours later my brand new $500 camera had vanished. When I went inside to talk to the hotel manager they said they were not responsible! I talked to the valet company, they said that I shouldn't have left it! I filed a police report and they said that they couldn't do anything either. I guess if you want to be a thief and never get in trouble when you steal you should go work for Embassy Suites Valet. It can be very profitable!

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: tjs4569
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is perfect for the Gaslamp, marina, and convention center. The trolley is also right next to the hotel but if you stay on the bay side, you won't hear any activity. My bathroom was not clean when I checked in and was never fully cleaned over the three days I was there. Also, I was overcharged and when I brought this up to the front desk, I received attitude and not one apology. I had to ask for a taxi to be called three times and again, I received attitude. I acknowledge that the price was incredible and that the overall value for this hotel is above average.

Reviews.Title: “loved the breakfast and the location”
Reviews.Author: San085
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the embassy suites. Was there for both business at the convention center (a 7 to 10 minute walk) and with the family. Loved breakfast (made to order omelets with veges and hot oatmeal for me, plus the usual) it was our best meal of the day. The pool was small. The room wasn't elegant or fancy with a few things broken that were mostly cosmetic, except for the refrigerator. It turned out that the outlet was broken but the engineers fixed the outlet by turning off the power to the room and reconnecting the wire in about an hour, which I thought was great. We had a city view, which my kids loved because the trains and trolleys went by. However, the diesels were very loud and woke me up. the hotel warns you about this and supplies earplugs. In all, I would say it was very well run...the hotel was completely booked and the hotel still ran very well. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, Nothing Special--Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: barryvo
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for four nights and had a training course at the same hotel. This Embassy Suites is nothing special but isn’t bad either. The location is nice and you can easily walk to good eating establishments. The breakfast and happy hour here are put on well. The front desk staff was very helpful and professional. This hotel is in a great location except for having to walk past all the homeless people (not the hotels fault). I decided not to rent a car since parking is $29 a night and it takes 15 to 30 min to get your car from the valet. The room itself was the typical Embassy Suites room. I booked a king but they were out, so they gave me a two double bed room with a harbor view. The view was fantastic although I would have not paid extra for it. The walls are a little thin and you need to shower before 6 if you want hot water, otherwise it will be warm at best (at least in room 910). The pool and fitness center are nicely done. One piece of advice if you stay here or other Hilton properties is to check to see if they are running a Hilton Honors Points special. I was able to get quadruple points for my four-night stay. They run this special every so often and it is currently going until 3/31/2011 (you have to sign up before your stay). Another tip is to tether your phone to your laptop to avoid the $13 day charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: heumanntouch
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be experienced, from the outside it does not look like much but once you get inside you start to realize that looks can be deceiving. We stayed in a corner room, man this room was bigger than some apartments. The Breakfast was good, but the weekend managers reception could use some hot food items, other than that there is a Deli less than 100 feet from the exit, a Starbucks and a Seafood Restaurant on premises. The train is very close as well.

Reviews.Title: “Clean nice rooms, good breakfast but don't expect to sleep more than 30 minutes at a time.”
Reviews.Author: heatherLA
Reviews.Content: Overall great hotel, but the train tracks were miserable keeping my entire family up all night. We literally almost packed up and left at 2:00 in the morning. Instead, we pulled out the sofa bed, turned on the fan and tried to get some sleep in the front room. I will definetly stay at the hotel in la jolla instead of this one because of the noise. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lafawnduh50
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this hotel for service and location. The morning breakfast is great. The evening cocktails can't be beat - was disappointed that the "snacks" were goldfish crackers, pretzels, chips and popcorn. Oh well, price was right for the rest of it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Jsh344
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on our way back to Dallas from the rose bowl. I have stayed at many other embassy suites, this one is one of the better, cleaner, newer, updated. Our room was harbor view, nice to watch the cruise ships come and go. You can also see the Navy yard across the bay...pretty cool, the uss Reagan aircraft carrier was parked there. Our room was updated, had new furniture, managers reception was great... No hassles. No line for breakfast, which was excellent as usual... Not a long walk to some great restaraunts, the uss midway, and the gaslamp district. We walked over and toured the uss midway, then ate dinner at "the fish market" on our way back to the hotel... Check my review on "the fish market" restaraunt... Excellent food! Hotel cost $29 to valet park, but there were no other options on parking...wasn't a problem for us. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone, embassy suites rarely let's us down!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, family oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: Musiclover9
Reviews.Content: After staying in the Pacific Beach area of San Diego, I moved downtown to Embassy Suites. This hotel is well situated at the harbor. The staff are extremely helpful and respond quickly to requests. The indoor pool is warm, clean, and well stocked with towels. There is is also a jacuzzi and a nice fitness center. The harbor view rooms on the upper floor provide a beautiful vista. The two room suites provide plenty of room for family. The unit not only had a sink in the bathroom; there was also a sink in the bedroom, and one in the area with the microwave and fridge. I went to breakfast every morning at 6:30 so did not encounter crowds or long lines. Although the hotel is huge, I was never bothered by noise and I am a light sleeper. The sleep away couch and chair in the living area are covered with some kind of fake leather, so they are utilitarian. There is also a good sized table and set of chairs in that area. I think that this hotel is a great value for families.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego trip”
Reviews.Author: SandeepJB
Reviews.Content: Went there with my family, including two teenagers. We stayed at the Embassy Suites. Nice place, very close to the Seaport Village and the museums etcs. The hotel serves a very nice complimentary breakfast, and also evening complimentary drinks on all weekdays. The proximity of the hotel to the Downtown, Seaport, Gaslamp quarter and Balboa park ensures that one doesn't really need to own/rent a car while there. There are plenty of shuttles available that can ferry the passengers to all the tourist spots. We spent the evenings walking around in the shops/restaurants of the Seaport village, visited the Maritime museum, USS Midway, Balboa Park and the San Diego Zoo. The only negative, in my view, was that the internet was not included in the price and there is a daily charge for the net. There was also a $29 valet parking fee. Overall, a very relaxing and pleasant experience, and I'd love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed ES downtown san diego”
Reviews.Author: xjohnnie3x
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed our experience. We were in town to go to a concert at the old sports arena. The hotel and room were very clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the complimentary drinks and breakfast as always. The on site restaurant was good and to our surprise was still open after the concert so we had a few cocktails. The location is great and easy to get in and out of. My only complaint is the high price of parking buy hey that's expected since its downtown. Valet was very helpful with directions to old town and other places. cabs were easy to locate to get us gaslamp. we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay at San Diego ES”
Reviews.Author: JRD33141
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Diego Embassy Suites (ES) from 04 - 06 November. This was my 2nd stay there. We investigated many hotels in San Diego before booking the ES mainly because on my previous visit, I was unable to get up to the Gaslamp District. (I was traveling with my 70 year old Dad for a Marine Corps reunion) After checking many reviews in the District, I happily booked a balcony suite at ES. First, the location of this ES cannot be beat. You can walk everywhere and we only used our car to go to the zoo. Second, the Staff could not be better. We prefer Embassy Suites when we travel because of the room space and hotel amenities. ES - San Diego does not fail in these categories! The breakfast was awesome and the breakfast team friendly. Parking is expensive but that seems to be standard for San Diego. We didn't consider onstreet parking. And we definitely recommend going to Ralph's grocery store a couple of blocks away and if you want a friendly cocktail and "locals" bar fun, go to Joe's Crab Shack behind the Convention Center. Both are within walking distance and you won't be disappointed. Concerning the Gaslamp District, we went on a Friday night and found most of the bars to be friendly but unless you really want to pay a cover charge - WALK AWAY and find another bar. We were led to believe this was the norm by the doorman at the place with the mechanical bull and found out that wasn't true. I refuse to pay cover charge unless there's entertainment. Some of the best drinks we found were at the TGI Friday's! Fun staff and great food/drinks. One downside to be aware of and this IS NOT the fault of the Embassy Suites. When walking downtown please be aware there seems to be a large number of homeless in the area. While we were never hassled, the number was surprising. It's a shame but that's the reality of our current economy. Not enough help for everyone. Again - this is no reflection of the ES and we always felt safe walking in the area. Others mentioned old furniture and TV issues. Our furniture in 1105, while not being brand new, was nice and not showing any damage. We had 2 large flat screen TVs that were great. We would like to see a safe added to the room for any valuables. And if you have the opportunity, book a balcony room. Shop around and get the best price possible. The view is incredible and well worth the difference in price. We look forward to returning to San Diego and the Embassy Suites soon. Many THANKS to the Staff for another great stay! L&J Miami Beach FL

Reviews.Title: “I like the location”
Reviews.Author: former_RX
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here for a stay-cation with the kids, and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Our 12th floor room had a view of the bay and the USS Midway. You'll see the Carnival Cruise dock nearby, too. Although not right at the water's edge, the location is walking distance to shops/restaurants at Seaport Village. You should skip Buster's Beach House, and opt for The Fish Market. The room itself is the typical suite design, with contemporary bath. The sofa bed was decent according to my older boy. I thought the room was beginning to show signs of age, with scratches on the furniture and tube television in the master. The wireless internet worked well. Be aware of train tracks nearby, and possible train noises/whistles in the evening. But our room was high enough that we didn't hear those noises.

Reviews.Title: “good service-good location”
Reviews.Author: Dele123
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week with my father, sister and daughter.It was perfect, the suites ,with a bedroom and living room area gave us all breathing space. Breakfasts were fab....no need for a lunch!! Rooms were clean and staff friendly and helpful.Always had a smile on their facees!!! The hotel is perfect for sightseeing and near the Horton Plaza and Trollys. The noise of the trains at night were not off putting and I liked the idea of the ear plugs!! I have stayed in the Embassy suite chain before and have never been dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: Tewfiks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bayside Embassy Suites in San Diego 10 days ago. My stay encompassed 6 nights. The hotel is dingy, stale and not very friendly. The room and common areas were not clean throughout my stay. Yes, you get free breakfast and cocktails in the evening, but you can do so much better for the rates the hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference venue if you're bringing the kids”
Reviews.Author: mark_mb
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a week at a conference with our two and four year old kids. This place is within walking distance of the conference center and there are quite a few things to do nearby. Room was fine and ours had a view of the aircraft carrier which the kids loved (so yes, go for the bay view upgrade). Breakfast and manager's reception were obviously busy but we never had problems finding a table for four. Only complaint for a summer stay would be that there is no outside pool, so you're stuck in your room if you don't want to go outside. Having said that, the foreshore park is close. Also, decent restaurants are a few minutes walk away, so bring the stroller and kiddy-board.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Michele0409
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for our 437th troop carrier group WWII reunion. Their service surpassed our expectations. The location is city center with great views of the harbor from the rooms. We were upgraded to the Presidental suite on the 12th floor that everyone hung out at. As some of the guest were in the 80's and even 90's--this is a WWII group after all, the hotel was handicapped accessible and we never felt cramped in any part of the hotel with all of the walkers, wheelchairs and strollers for the great-grandchildren. Breakfast was real social each morning and the staff helpful with immediately cleaning off tables for the next guest. We had our banquet the last night--staff was accomodating to last minute requests, banquet room was super clean ( the rug) spacious and the food was superurb.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience but could have been great”
Reviews.Author: JLDCA
Reviews.Content: When I got up to my room, I found the exterior sliding glass doors did not lock. The front desk said they would be up to fix it but three days later it still had not been fixed. My shower drain was clogged but in fairness to the hotel, I did not call them. All in all, an OK but nothing special stay for $179/night.. If you want internet connectivity it will cost $12 per day, no airport transportation either and parking is expensive. Good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room and run down furniture.”
Reviews.Author: Vacashunr
Reviews.Content: I must say I am extremely disappointed. My family of four almost exclusively stays at an embassy suites hotel for our vacations and weekend get aways each year for the past 8 years. The service is always great and the amenities superb, however this visit I'm ready to pack up my bags and head for cleaner accommodations. Our room is filthy. The dust around the corners of the room is so severe my sinuses are going crazy. You can smell the dirt. I used my iPhone to take photos of all the dust. My husband is a by diamond member and management will most certainly hear about this issue. There's hair against the wall near the headboard. So much that I took the bed skirts off the bed because they were full of hair. Disgusting! The only reason we've not left us because i traveled aged if my husband with our twins and I'm too tired to drag the kids someplace else. My husband on the other hand will have little tolerance for this foolishness. As well, the furniture is beat up and severely damaged(took photos of this too). It looks as if they went into storage and found mixed pieces to furnish the room. Not at all what I expect from an embassy suites. We definitely will not return to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a business/pleasure stay”
Reviews.Author: WanderingVirginian
Reviews.Content: I traveled to a professional meeting with my spouse and college age son and this hotel met our needs very well. The location was great for access to the convention center, major tourist attractions on the bay, and public transportation. We walked about 4 miles from the hotel to the San Diego Zoo, though not everyone would enjoy walking that far. The hotel was well maintained and our room had good bedding and the amenities of microwave and fridge. We got a room with a balcony, which was very nice for viewing the events in the harbor. We like staying at this chain when traveling with our son due to everyone having adequate privacy. One of the best aspects to this hotel was a particularly well-equipped work out room and a nice pool and whirlpool area. There is a good business center with three public access computers and a printer. Don't know if there is free in-room internet access. We stayed for six nights and the breakfast buffet was the same each day, which was a little boring by the end. Otherwise, our stay was very nice. The hotel concierge was helpful. This hotel does not have an airport shuttle, but it is nearby, $11.00 cab fare each way before tip. One thing to note, it is difficult to get from the hotels in San Diego to the Wild Animal Park, as no public transportation is available to go there. We took public transportation (trolley and city bus) to get to Sea World. Takes a little planning but is easy to do. Fun city and nice hotel. Not inexpensive to stay at this hotel, but worth it if location and need for space are important.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience All Around”
Reviews.Author: tarheeltr8veler
Reviews.Content: I almost switched to another hotel after reading all the complaints re: $29 daily parking, which is probably closer to $35 after tacking on all the taxes/fees/surcharges etc. I am so GLAD I didn't! There is tons of street parking and other metered parking within 1 block of the hotel and overnight (6 p.m. to 8 a.m.) there is not cost. At 50 cents/hour I spent exactly 1 dollar per day for parking during my 4 day stay at the Embassy Suites. About four blocks up G street is Ralph's grocery with terrific prepared foods, according to my 9 year old they have the best chicken nuggets anywhere (3/$1.00), and the sushi is prepared daily. The microwave and refrigerator come in handy for storing yummy stuff from Ralphs. Location is perfect for walking and one night we took concierge recommendation on restaurant on the waterfront. She called over to make our reservation at The Harbour House. The manager greeted us during our meal, verifying that we were staying at ES and offered us all complimentary desert just for being guests at ES! We had room service one night and the food was so good as to make the $5 delivery charge and compounded 18% gratuity truly worth it. Each evening, after long day in the sun, the kids very much enjoyed the pool and hot tub. Snacks at manager's reception not quite up to par with other ES or Hilton club level lounges but with unlimited free drinks, I really can't complain about it. The view from my 8th floor corner suite is terrific. One of my favorite things to do this vacation is watch the ships, yachts and naval vessels coming and going through the busy harbor. I only wish the windows were a little cleaner. The beds are comfortable, bathroom, bar and kitchenette sinks/counters are all marble and nicer than any other ES I have stayed at. Having multiple sinks comes in handy when everybody is brushing teeth at bedtime.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel- Top Marks!”
Reviews.Author: LadyDiana1
Reviews.Content: Super hotel. I was staying in San Diego for Business on my own and this hotel was perfect. Ideal location (walking distance to main shops and harbour) Rooms were massive! I have never stayed in a room so big!! My room was very clean and had an amazing bathroom (mirrors everywhere). Staff was very friendly and couldn’t help enough. And as for the breakfasts!!!!!! AMAZING! Everything you can imagine- pancakes/ omelettes / fry-up/ fruit! Loved it. Top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay along the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: maxpaste
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the free breakfast buffet, free cocktail hour, and the great proximity to the waterfront. We wanted to tour the Midway and Nautical museum, for example, and they were easily walkable. The Gaslamp area and Seaport Village are walkable as well. The inside atrium of the hotel is quite impressive. We asked the concierge for restaurant recommendations - he made a reservation for us near the Seaport Village, and much to our surprise we were given free desserts because we were Embassy Suites guests. I can recommend this place without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Best So Far”
Reviews.Author: dagfadg
Reviews.Content: I may have been very young, but there wasn't nothing to do while I stayed. I was even friends with a fish I named Bull.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Form, Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: ricky2batz
Reviews.Content: I arrived for a four night stay at around 11 PM, after a three hour flight delay from the east coast. I made my reservation three or four weeks in advance and guaranteed it for late arrival with my American Express card. At check-in, the front desk manager told me the hotel was completely sold out for that night and there were no rooms to be had. My arguments fell on deaf ears -- that I had a reservation guaranteed for late arrival, that if I did not show up I would have been billed for that night anyway, and that I have been a Hilton Honors Gold member for more than 15 years. The manager insisted there were no more rooms and that he'd be sending me to the Omni -- nowhere near my meeting, which started at 8 AM the next day. While we were arguing, another man arrived for check-in. Miraculously, the front desk clerk had a room for him. I asked why someone who arrived after me was able to get a room when there were supposedly none left. The answer? Because he prepaid for his stay. This was a lame excuse. If I knew that I had to prepay my room to guarantee it, I would have. And optically, it looks horrible to give a room to someone who shows up after me, for whatever reason. How about making it up to me, Embassy Suites?

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: wjs1968
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after flight was cancelled due to ash cloud problems. We were really impressed with everything - great location, enormous rooms, fab breakfast(which was included) and friendly staff - wish we were delayed longer ! Have stayed at the Hyatt before - which is over the road - and although lovely - would return to the Embassy Suites, not only because of the value but the benefit of the huge suites with microwave , fridge and coffee maker

Reviews.Title: “Still love the place, but bring back Turtle Town! :)”
Reviews.Author: jalapenohotel
Reviews.Content: We've been going to this hotel for at least 5 years and usually stay 4 nights. It's our last "Hurrah" of the summer before school starts. Always a positive experience. You can really tell a quality place when you see the same staff year after year. There's tall bellman that's is always helpful. The breakfast chef always has a mischeivous twinkle in his eye. And... the true gem of the place... JEN at the social hour. She sports a pleasant attiude and super sweet smile. Like I said, we've been there once a year, for at least 5 years. It's uncanny how she is able to look at me for my order and within 2 seconds say, "Welcome back!" and truly remember me. Easy driving to SEA WORLD... hop and a skip the the Midway Aircraft Carrier and fun vendors at Seaport Village.... under 15 minute walk to PETCO Park (nice tour)...and a STARBUCKS just out the side door. What else do you need? Typical Embassy fare of yummy breakfast, fun happy hour (bring your salsa though...why don't they put it out with all the chips?), spacious rooms with fridge and microwave. Am a Hilton Honors gold member, so was able to use free internet. Had interruption on 2nd day so called the desk and they quickly connected me with the provider who immediately overrode the system and had me connected for the rest of the stay. Restaurant in the hotel is nice too. They lost the sushi bar; sigh. But still have yummy food. They added happy hour pricing on appetizers. Nice break for the economy. Try the calamari and spicy wings. Sabrina is very helpful. Bring back Turtle Town! Okay, silly complaint, but really had a special spot in our hearts for Turtle Town. This Embassy has nice atrium area with waterways. Used to have a cute area named Turtle Town. Kids always looked forward to feeding the fish and seeing the turtles. Last year due to some salmonella scare they booted out the turtles and fish. Some smaller fish are back this year. Not the same. Don't like the $29 forced valet parking. In the beginning, was able to choose between "self park" and valet options. Now have to use VALET. Goes up every year. Also, wish they didn't allow pets in the rooms. Why aren't they more concerned about dog hair in the carpet than possible salmonella from turtles way behind a fence. Overall, great place to stay and return to in the future. See you next year. Tell Jen HI!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, have stayed here many times”
Reviews.Author: killbondnow
Reviews.Content: This ES is one of the better ones (and ES'ers know what I'm talking about), with one of the best breakfasts -- set up to do eggwhite-only and/or spinach omelets without special ordering, and a much better selection of both cooked to order and buffet foods than the typical ES has. The restaurant is hit-or-miss every time we've stayed there, but the bar is always good. Starbucks in the hotel, AND they do room service delivery of your coffee drinks in the a.m. if you want (and don't mind paying the automatic 18% service charge tacked on!). We just made the quick trip downstairs and saved that exorbitant fee. As far as a previous review and the distance to the train station, well, it's only 2 blocks away. I'm a large-size person and even *I* can walk it easily, schlepping my luggage or not. Not sure why someone would expect a valet parker or doorman to drive them, it's not their job. And besides, there is nearly always a taxi, and always plenty of pedi-cabbers out front, happy to take you anywhere you want to go (if you care to use their services). As far as the valet parking negative review, I have had *no* problems having the valets retrieve my car, even if I left something in it. That's, uh, the idea of valet parking. They don't hold your car hostage 24/7, for heaven's sake! I don't understand that review at all. This is a great hotel for ease of getting to freeways for access to local attractions, and about a 4-long-block walk from the convention center. I stay here as often as I can when I go to SD. Warning though: The swimming pool is on the lobby level, literally across a travertine MARBLE floor from the elevator lobby. WEAR POOL SHOES, even flipflops can be slick. Be careful! They try to keep the marble floor dry, but kids often run back and forth dripping, including into the elevators which also have slick floors. That is the only negative aspect of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kevkbut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over the 4th of July weekend knowing we would rarely be in the hotel itself. Great location for everything on the Bay, the San Diego attractions and the airport. When traveling with kids, it is so helpful to have the extra sitting room a suite offers, and here was roughly the same price or cheaper then a regular room (non suite) at nearby hotels. Viewed the fireworks on the 3rd from the room, walked across the street for the big ones on the 4th. We checked in late on a sold out weekend but still got the bay view we booked (though right across from the elevators, which was a little noisy but not terrible). Got a late checkout approved simply by asking at check-in. The free breakfast was real crowded, but good as far as buffet food goes. I didn't want to wait for made to order food, but it was available. Enjoyed a few Guinness at the hotel bar, and was even offered some free appetizers. Yes it's $29 to valet park each day, but that seems to be common in the area. The pool and hut tub looked inviting, but didn't have time to use them. The business center printer was out of order at the time, so I couldn't print out the discount tickets for the Midway or our airline boarding passes, otherwise I had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Front Row Seat to 4th of July Fireworks at San Diego Bay”
Reviews.Author: LadyPearl47
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in order to enjoy the Big Bay fireworks show. Our room had a fantastic view to the Bay and Ocean beyond, with a front row seat to enjoy the fireworks. We chose the Hilton package for pets, and at our check in, we were welcomed with a gift bag containing a doggy blanket and treats which was way cool. Our pet deal also included the parking, which was a good thing since it's pretty expensive to park downtown. The room was a little differently laid out from other Embassy Suites since our teen son, who was sleeping on the pull out sofa bed, would have to walk in to our room to enter the bathroom. Not a big deal since we were there only one night, but for longer stays it might get awkward. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: mkrating
Reviews.Content: My wedding party booked rooms at the Embassy Suites hotel in preparation of my wedding to be held in San Diego on 6/25/10. At first everything seemed fine - nice rooms, decent location, etc. On the day of our wedding rehearsal, my 86 year old father had not shown up yet to the hotel to check in. He was driving from central California and does not have a cell phone. So, I left a message with the staff at the front desk asking them to contact me when he arrived. Well, hours passed and I never received a call. I called back several times to the front desk to make sure he had not arrived. I was given the room number he was supposed to be in and I called his room several times. No answer. Before we left for the rehearsal to be held at 4:30 p.m., I again went to the front desk, gave them my phone number, and yet again asked them to contact me when he arrived. Our wedding party went to the rehearsal and then on to the rehearsal dinner - still no dad. We called several more times to the front desk to find out if he had arrived. At one point, I was crying on the phone with them because I was so worried about my father possibly being lost or having been hurt somehow since being late is NOT like him. Each time we called, we were told he had not checked in yet. My wedding party began calling the California Highway Patrol, AAA, relatives, friends, etc. to find out what had happened to my father. Needless to say, I was a wreck. When we finally got back to the hotel after the rehearsal dinner, one of my best friends actually got into her car and began driving in the direction my dad would have been coming from. By the way, ten hours had passed since my father had left from home at 11:00 a.m. (for a four to five hour drive). I decided to call his room again. By this time, it is about 9:00 p.m. My father answered the phone!! He had been at the hotel for hours but had been told by staff when he checked in at 4:15ish that I had left already. No call was made to me. No phone number was given to him to call. Each time our party called the front desk to find out if he had checked in, we were told he had not. If any of you out there have gotten married or been part of a wedding recently, you know the stress of just planning this event, let alone having to deal with the emotional turmoil of something like this. When management was contacted, they essentially took no responsibility for this and even suggested my 86 year old father somehow snuck into a room on his own without getting any keys. How he was suppossed to have done this is beyond me, but that is what the night manager, Ms. Willes, suggested. She also claimed my father actually arrived at 2:15 p.m. (impossible even though she claims it is true) and therefore it was the a.m. team's fault and not hers. She had the gall to argue with me on the phone about this on the night before my wedding. The general manager for San Diego, John Smith, actually decided to call me ON my wedding day to essentially confirm what Ms. Willes stated. Thankfully my bridesmaids handled these calls for me since there was no way I wanted my wedding day to be ruined by such lies. Basically, this is what it comes down to: if you actually want decent customer service, don't go to this hotel. They claim to be a full service, upscale hotel, but they can't even relay simple messages. Because of their incompetence and even simple lack of compassion for another human being, my 86 year old father missed his only child's wedding rehearsal and rehearsal dinner. My mother is dead so this was a very big deal to me as well, not to mention I thought that something terrible had happened to my father. The day was RUINED. I can't recommend this hotel to anyone. I am still so angry at what they did and especially at the lies they continue to make up to cover themselves. I wish I had never stayed at this hotel and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: UpNOut
Reviews.Content: Parking is expensive in San Diego, so this hotel is within walking distance to Seaport Village, the MIDWAY, harbor tours, the Convention Center, Coronado Ferry, etc. It's an older very nicely refurbished hotel. Large rooms, well appointed. It seems to cater mostly to business travelers. Small pool was closed during my stay. Attached Starbuck's, for those that can't do without. All the help were friendly, courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Fine, Parking a Problem”
Reviews.Author: BolsaChicaMoonDancer
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting the Embassy Suites in San Diego for many years. It is a wonderful place for families with children. The view of the bay from the balcony is gorgeous and the staff is very helpful and courteous. The manager's reception and the breakfast are wonderful. The rooms are OK. Valet parking is mandatory. There is no self parking. The major minus is that once the valet takes a guest's car, the guest cannot have any access, whatsoever to the car. When asked about getting a cell phone charger from the car, we were told we can't have access to our car until we leave. The 29 dollar parking fee is not the problem, but the lack of access to the car is. When we commented to the front desk about not having access to the car, we were told it is for security reasons. At 29 dollars a car times 11 stories of guest rooms, the nightly revenue would more than adequately pay for round the clock security for the parking garage. This frustration spoiled what would have been a very nice visit. Enjoy the Embassy Suites, just be sure to take every single item from your car when the valet takes it at the front door because if you need something, you won't get it until you leave.

Reviews.Title: “San Deigo Vacation”
Reviews.Author: catloverkk
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel close to everything! We stayed in a King Suite for 3 days with our 2 children and were very comfortable. The beds were very comfortable and my kids loved the heated pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: GeGe_OrangeBeachAL
Reviews.Content: My stay at Embassy Suites was very good. The breakfast selections were super and included cooked-to-order omelets, potatoes, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, cereal, yogurt, several types of fruits and juices. Outstanding breakfast. The evening cocktails were also a great value. The staff was always friendly. I even needed maintenance during my stay (the bathroom light switched stopped working) -- I called the front desk and the switch was replaced within 30 minutes! Parking is $29/night, but that's pretty standard in downtown San Diego (that's still a rip-off, though). Wi-Fi is $12.95/day -- also a rip-off -- which is why I exclusively use my AT&T Connect Card (I LOVE my laptop Connect Card). BEST EXPERIENCE ON THIS TRIP -- Embassy Suites had outstanding customer service! WORST EXPERIENCE ON THIS TRIP - Delta Airlines had the most HORRIBLE customer service! They either don't care OR they have "gotten too big for their britches." I strongly recommend a stay at the San Diego Bay Embassy Suites, but definitely DON'T travel via Delta Airlines!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: azstout
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the tail end of our Southern California Pass trip, after seeing Disneyland and Universal Studios, we were headed to Sea World. We planned to drive to San Diego from Anaheim and spend a few hours at the beach and then check into our hotel. Unfortunately, the traffic was horrendous. What should have been a two hour drive was over 4 hours, so the beach trip was out. We arrived at the hotel a little early, and were prepared to pay for the required valet parking. Seems like most of the hotels (especially in downtown) have parking fees. After we had gotten our room key, I asked to confirm that the room had a pull out couch. Sure enough, there was no pull out couch. Since we have four kids, we needed the extra bed. They offered a roll away for more $, which was unacceptable to me. I had booked our entire vacation through Costco travel. With four kids, it is difficult to find hotels that allow four kids in the room, and Costco was able to secure us a great hotel in Anaheim with plenty of room for all of us. I ended up calling Costco travel and they spoke to the front desk people and were able to get us a room with a pull out couch as we had originally requested. That room type wasn’t available yet, so the manager suggested that we hang out in the pool, which we did for about an hour until our room was ready. The evening social hour was great, they had beer, wine, and some mixed drinks available too. Food-wise, it was just nachos and popcorn. For dinner, we walked to the Fish Market (it was a long walk, but it was beautiful outside). The breakfast buffet in the morning was fantastic, and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this hotel for a spring break family trip”
Reviews.Author: Mary29_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two boys and we really enjoyed it. The free breakfast buffet every morning was wonderful. And we loved the free happy hour every evening. The indoor pool was very nice, and I liked that the hot tub was outside. I thought the rooms were great. We thougt about staying at the Manchester Hyatt next door, but the rooms are not suites. And since we stayed a whole week, it was wonderful having a suite with the extra space. A couple small gripes is the $29.00 parking every day, but I'm guessing all the similar hotels have the same fee. And yes the toilet always had a small puddle behind it, not a big deal to me, I just threw a towel down. And the room definitely need more drawer spaces. There were only three medium sized drawers (for 4 people). They had all this cabinetry that easily could be fitted with drawer space. Those are minor gripes, overall we really enjoyed the hotel, the rooms looked nice, the pool was great, the free food and drinks were wonderful, the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not in Seaport Village”
Reviews.Author: ckennedy42
Reviews.Content: This hotel appears to be right in Seaport Village, but it's one and a half blocks away on two busy streets. That was disappointing. The bed was not comfortable and the pillows were like two sandbags. For the money it was not worth it. I usually really like Embassy Suites, but this one is overpriced. The reception and breakfast was very good. The staff was friendly, but for the price, it just wasn't worth it. Parking was very expensive, and there is no where else to park. Internet is also expensive, so our stay totalled abougt $300 a night! Ouch. Stay at the Marriott. You get more for the money and it is right in Seaport Village.

Reviews.Title: “Choo Choo !”
Reviews.Author: vctr
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to San Diego and enjoyed it very much. We chose the embassy suites because of it's location and good reviews. This hotel is in the perfect location if you really want to see the city. Gas lamp, Horton Mall, USS Midway and just about all city attractions are with in minutes walk. The hotel room did show some wear but found it to be ultra clean, the bed was extremely comfortable and the breakfast was very good as well with many choices to choose from. The service was good and concierge went above and beyond to help us through the city. The only thing to be aware of is a room on the north east corner of this hotel, at 11:30, 12:30, 1:30, and 4:30 AM the Coaster and Amtrak start blasting horns at a crossing street level behind this section of the building. I know this is not the hotels problem but unfortunately these are the cheaper city view rooms, guess you get what you pay for ! Do not let this scare you away from this hotel because the trolley and trains run throughout the city, just be aware when booking a room and where these lines run. I did not complain and I'm sure they would have moved us if I did, good thing I packed my earplugs !

Reviews.Title: “4.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: margies2001
Reviews.Content: The main negative about this hotel (Embassy Suits, downtown San Diego) is that it is a bit run down. The furniture is a bit scarred. The cupboards under the sink are a bit worn. There was rust running down the tiles from the safety/handicap bar in our shower. Another negative is the cost of parking. If you have a car, there is nowhere to pare, except the hotel and it is required valet parking (no self parking.) Also, I got woken up by traffic noise every morning, even though we were on the 11th floor. Otherwise, we enjoyed this hotel. The pool is indoors and heated. They offer a full, free breakfast, including made-to-order eggs/omlettes, warm pancakes/french toast, bacon/sausage, cereal (4 kinds), milk (nonfat and regular), juice (4 kinds), coffee, flavored coffee, fruit, bread, sweet rolls, donuts, and muffins. There is a reception at night that offers free drinks (alcohol included) and hor de ourves. It is close (walking distance) to major downtown locations (conference center, Sea Port Village, Midway Aircraft Carrier, Tall Flag Ships, and the Gas Lamp District. The sheets and towels were clean. The view of the harbor ant night was beautiful. The lobby/central area is beautiful, featuring a meandering waterway filled with fish and turtles (my kids even got to feed the fish one morning), pathways, bridges, and lots of plants. The staff is extremely helpful. My son had some homework that his teacher had sent with him. One assignment required him to illustrate a concept with color, but he had not brought his colored pencils. The front desk had crayons! (They offered us a coloring book, too, but my son is 11!)

Reviews.Title: “Typical Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: memparrot
Reviews.Content: Typical Embassy Suites. Nothing special but still good. Rooms clean, good breakfast., good service, nice indoor pool. Starbucks in hotel. The only thing I did not like is $29 parking.

Reviews.Title: “Best anniversary ever!”
Reviews.Author: ddgSealBeach
Reviews.Content: We wanted to celebrate our 40th anniversary somewhere special and yet fairly local so we chose Embassy Suites, San Diego. Wow! were we impressed.! The room had a fantastic bay view. The amazing, friendly, and efficient staff treated us to a tray of fresh strawberries with assorted cheeses, and crackers, and a free in room movie. We were able to walk to the Gas Lamp District for a fabulous steak dinner on Friday following the Manager's Reception and then to Shore Line Village Sunday morning after a delicious omelet breakfast. We felt relaxed and pampered as we drove home.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: explorer50uk
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel from 30th Dec til 2nd Jan 2010 and had a thoroughly great stay.On arrival we were told we had a smoking room!! then told that there were no other rooms available. I asked for a manager and was asked if I would consider the room for 1 night, after explaining that I had a chest infection she gave us a room on the 11th floor with a view directly across to the USS Midway. Apart from the one slight hiccup we were impressed by the friendly staff in the hotel and enjoyed our stay. The rooms was very nice, beds were fabulous....so comfortable!! a tv in each room and the internet worked perfectly. The daily breakfast was good, we were always up early and did not experience any lines, there was a good selection of items and coffee was good and hot. We managed to to get to the managers nightly reception a few times and were impressed again by the choice of drinks available. Swimming pool was indoors, nice and warm and always quiet in the afternoon. The location had a safe feeling and we were able to walk to the downtown Gaslamp area in 5 minutes. USS Midway was right across from the hotel and the cruise ship terminal is only a few minutes cab ride away.. We intend to stay at the Embassy suites again. on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: FairwayFound
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several nights for meetings. The view was spectacular. From my windows and Balcony I peered out over the entire harbor. The room was typical Embassy Suites, which is good. Their breakfast is a great feature.

Reviews.Title: “American Express # stolen by hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler155
Reviews.Content: When I checked into the property, my card was swiped at the front desk. The front desk person was never out of my sight. I went to my room for the evening. The following morning I received a call from American Express asking if I was trying to purchase groceries in the 400.00. Two more attempts were made on my card number. Thankfully, AmExp caught the unusual activity and rejected the charges. My AmExp card was canceled (one the first day of my week-long business trip!). The manager at the hotel never returned my calls. I was never offered any type of compensation for my trouble.

Reviews.Title: “The 5 hour check-in”
Reviews.Author: SEODelafield_wi
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 2:00 PM. Check-in is 4:00 PM but hoped we could get in early. Clerk told us to come back closer to 4:00 so we ... checked our luggage with them and took a walk downtown. Came back around 4:00, checked in and went to our room. Problem was that the room had no view and no balcony even though we were paying for a balcony room with a harbor view. Called manager to complain and was told that they can change your room type ("inventory" she called it) if they need to and since we booked via an online travel service, no refund for the lesser room would/could be made. After a lot of needless arguing and headache, we eventually got the room we booked 5 hours after arrival which caused us to miss a planned dinner with the family. It seemed apparent that part of the problem was lack of communication between the front desk and housekeeping. At one point after figuring this out I offered to clean my room myself, and would have if they had let me. Other than that the stay was fine. We were there 8 days. It is a very good location. If you're up to it, you can walk to lots of attractions, good restaurants, downtown, Midway museum, harbor cruises, trolley etc. etc.etc... The valet parking was expensive, but there are no other cheaper options and the service was quite good other than once around checkout time on a really busy Sunday. The morning breakfast was great (had no problems with crowds) and the late afternoon drinks and snacks was nice, although we were often not there for it. If it weren't for the check-in problem, we'd rate it higher.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Kattimus
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to San Diego on business, but brought the family along to have some fun during my time off. This hotel was really nice - everything you'd expect from an Embassy Suites. The location is great - an easy walk to Seaport Village and an easy drive to just about everywhere else. I really have nothing bad to say about this hotel. It's not luxurious - it's just really nice and provides a lot of space. The restaurant downstairs (Pacific something) was just okay. I'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: j_wied83
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Great breakfast and nice views of the water. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: moder4all
Reviews.Content: My daughter had performance with her dance group in san diego area so we decided to turn it to a mini vacation. Also joined us another family whowas in the same situation and have children the same age as ours. We had so much fun that we were planing our next trip together to the same location before even leaving the hotel the last day.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodations were very good, valet parking was not.”
Reviews.Author: 6Mitch
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and very accommodating. The breakfast buffet included something for everyone, including fresh fruit, made-to-order eggs, pastries, etc. and the staff was courteous and efficient. The daily valet parking charge of $29 and line to wait for your car in the morning and checking back in at night is not convenient or timely. Cost of internet use in room is not what we are used to.

Reviews.Title: “A Major Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: LouisOrange_CA
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay at Embassy Suites on both long and short vacations – we’re big fans. Yet I have to say this Embassy Suites is the most challenging one to feel positive about. It’s not just one thing – like the ling lines for breakfast – no; it’s several that happened over the weekend of August 15th & 16th: These are all true experiences at this hotel over the weekend: Called on Friday afternoon to confirm that the Bay View, Balcony room I had booked on the Embassy Suites website was ready. I was told yes, your reservation is fine. I informed the front desk I was driving down from L.A. and would be there by 10. We arrived at 9:30pm.Our Bay View, Balcony room had been sold by the time we arrived. In less than 3 hours our room had been sold. We were given a room instead with no balcony, a broken TV, and a refrigerator that wheezed like a chain smoker. The next night we were moved to a Bay View, Balcony View right outside the elevators. Starting at 6am on Sunday morning parents in this hotel let their kids run wild. Like to wake up to ringing elevator buttons? Yea, we didn’t either. NOTE: THIS HOTEL HAS ONE OF THE NOISEST INTERIORS DUE TO KIDS RUNNING WILD TO THE ELEVATORS IN THE MORNING, SCREAMING. It is a very loud, very difficult place to feel comfortable in. The rooms have a dated feel to them and our second room had stains for who-knows-what spilled on them – looked like a major party had gone down in the room. Granted, the hotel did give me a discount of my two nights, a token if you will for completely screwing up my first night’s reservation. Yet the service was still bad, the rooms still looking like they had been through at least five or more fraternity parties and the food so-so. Yes, you save on food with a family yet the lines for omelettes are on average 15 – 20 minutes in the morning. And here is the final straw and why I decided to write this review: Valet parking, $29 – and for that I get my car delivered on Sunday morning that when I turned on the engine a hard rock station, turned up full blast, blared into our ears. Yes, priceless. I will never be back again. Go to the San Diego Embassy Suites in La Jolla instead, a much, much better value.

Reviews.Title: “What we expected”
Reviews.Author: chuckking
Reviews.Content: We used Hilton points to get a free night stay on July 28th in the downtown area before we moved 30 miles further inland to Barona Valley Ranch Hotel & Casino for our 4 days 3 nights R & R. It was our 2nd stay at an Embassy Suites Hotel (first one in Garden Grove near Disneyland two years ago). Everything was what we expected: A clean and spacious two room suite with a re- frigerator, a microwave and two TVs, a friendly and helpful hotel staff, a partial view of the bay and the USS Midway, and lots of kids. After a quick check in and a little freshening up, we walked around Seaport Village, a nice picturesque tourist spot by the bay with shops and restaurants right across from the hotel. Then we went to Manager's reception at 5:30 to relax before we headed to Sea World. My wife had a glass of wine (you can have as many drinks as you can handle). My son and I had sodas and tortilla chips. The last time I visited Sea World was in the 70's, when they still had the water ski show. We saw the sea lion show that night and would see the rest of the shows on our 2nd day. For dinner we had barbe- cue combo (chicken, pork and beef). it was very good and reasonably priced. We bought the 2 day ticket for $52 per person at AAA before our trip. So for the price of admission and what they have to offer, Sea World is better value than Disneyland. The next morning we particularly enjoyed the complementary cooked-to-order breakfast. The hot items included omelet, bacon, sausage, hash browns and pan- cakes. The cold item included cereals, donuts, muffins and assorted fruits, plus tea, coffee, cappuccino, hot chocalate and juice. Most of the guests had their breakfast in the atruiums. But we like to bring our breakfast back to our room to eat and relax. the hotel charges $29 for valet parking and fee for internet access. That turned off some people but I just added that as part of our total vacation expenses. So all in all it was a nice stay. I would recommend this hotel. But if you don't have kids, you might want to consider some other area hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Pricey Parking, Needs a bit of an overhaul!”
Reviews.Author: dubtb
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights recently. Our suite had 4 adults and 2 children (age 11 & 14). 2 adults used the sofa-bed. After the first night we had to request they swtich out the matress as it was very uncomforable. The second one was only a small percentage better. We've stayed in a suite as a family several times before and never had any problems with comfort, maybe it's time for them to replace and do an overhaul of all the sofa-beds in the hotel. We also had to ask for extra towels (or else get them from the pool area) as they only left 4 each time (not too much put-out by this but thought it's a nice touch that one doesn't have to follow up on the small things). Overall I also thought the hotel could do with a bit of an overhaul. Parking at $30/night is quite steep and would love to see an improvement on that. We didn't have any noise issues as we were in an ocean facing suite (only the neighbors banging their doors each time they went out).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Economical”
Reviews.Author: patricka5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in two rooms at the end of July. The rooms were standard Embassy Suites - spacious and fairly nice. We enjoyed the free cocktail hour and probably saved at least $100 for our family with the free breakfast. Compared to the Hilton Bayside down the street which we stayed the next night, this was quite a bargain and was very well run. The valet parking went well and this hotel still doesn't charge for their business center while other hotels are starting to charge for this center. Overall, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Yet Again”
Reviews.Author: elizabethamira
Reviews.Content: This hotel has exceeded my expectations yet again. We stayed here last year and had such a good stay, I booked it again. First, they had a room available for me for early check-in at 1:00pm and after a long flight from D.C. I was looking forward to some relaxation. The bellmen and front desk staff were attentive and very nice and very helpful. I had had surgery on July 15th on my knees and they did all they could to get my bags upstairs and even asked if I needed them to run to the ice and snack machines or to the Starbucks. They gave great take-out recommendations, were quick with housekeeping requests like towels and pillows, and made the whole trip enjoyable. The breakfast was delicious every morning, the manager's reception was a nice thing in the afternoon (especially after long days in the convention center), the inside was nice with the gardens, and we were fortunate to have a room on the 11th floor with a lovely view of the water. I will certainly be staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with free happy hour!”
Reviews.Author: Kimba57
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay over July 4th weekend . Was fortunate to have the room type I requested on a high floor away from the elevators. Room was very clean and quiet, and the beds were comfortable. Even with the holiday crowds, we had no problem finding a table during the free manager’s reception or at breakfast. Location is within easy walking distance to Gaslamp District, Seaport Village and Embarcadero. There was a slight wait for the valet when we needed the car, but this was to be expected considering the busy weekend. I was not traveling with children, but I wasn’t the least bit bothered by the families with young kids. Main purpose of this trip was shopping and beaches. Visited Coronado, La Jolla, Pacific Beach, Mission Beach, and Dog Beach. If you love dogs and have never been to Dog Beach (at Ocean Beach), I highly recommend a visit. Parking is easy, and it is so fun watching dogs of every breed, shape and size playing in the sand and water.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: cbalmaceda
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the embassy san diego bay on the 4th of july weekend. the hotel was sold out...a lot of people in the lobby.. i found the front desk agent the checked us in very polite. she was very polite and helpful eventhough they are very busy... the bellman that assisted with our luggage was also helpful... he gave us a lot of ideas where to go.. we walked to the seaport village which is right across the street from the hotel. my kids loved it...we've seen some fireworks..and it's nice to just walk to the seaport village... the room was also great...we had a room with 1 king bed...my 2 daughters slept in the sofa bed which is big enough for the 2 of them . the room has 2 tv..one in the bedroom and 1 in the living room..it was nice coz the kids stayed up late while we sleep in the bedroom.. we will definitely go back again to this hotel.. i will definitely recommend this hotel especially if you want to be close to downtown san diego and seaport village. and great for families too...as they have their free breakfast..saves me a lot of money..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location for convention center”
Reviews.Author: cvandenbraak
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Embassy Suites on Sunday, June 28th and stayed until July 1st. I think they were overwhelmed with checkin since my room was ready at 4 p.m. exactly. However the room was clean, modern and safe. I had everything I needed for my stay. The manager's reception was a nice addition after a long day at the conference. The breakfast in the morning was very good, quick and everyone concerned that you had what you needed. The Pacific Fish Company on site was OK, Menu with few choices and food was OK for price, not as good as I would have liked. Service was very good and it was clean area. I found that the entire area was expensive...Starbucks coffee, fish company and daily charge of internet. Other Hilton Hotels do not charge for this but I guess it is the area. Would definitely recommend the Embassy Suite if you are staying for more than one day or so for a conference, convention, etc. The room to spread out in and get work done is great!
