Fitness Center was one of the best also. If you do stay in downtown San Diego, get ready for regular trolleys and trains throughout all times of day and night. Area is safe to walk or jog in also. Great scenery with everyone out with their dogs! Can walk about 10 minutes to Horton Center for shopping (again a little pricey) but if you need anything , it will be there!

Reviews.Title: “Average Embassy”
Reviews.Author: ObLaDiObLaDa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Embassy Suites. They are great for families and are usually reasonably priced. This one is middle of the pack. Being in San Diego, I expected it to be a top tier Embassy. I was here on vacation with my wife and three teenagers. It met our needs and not much more. There were some positives. 1. Location. It is in the heart of everything and is an easy walk or drive to most everything you will want to do in San Diego, including Coronado. 2. The concierge was helpful. 3. Business Center. Better than most Embassys. Had 3-4 computers and free printing. The downsides. 1. Breakfast was below average. Messy floors and tables. Food was nothing special and they ran out of several items. 2. Our room and the hotel in general, are in need of a facelift. Moldy smells, dirty floors, walls and kitchen serving area. 3. $29/day parking fee. This seems outrageous. 4. Front desk personnel seemed apathetic and did not have answers to several of my questions regarding San Diego. Later, the concierge helped out. Was it the worst Embassy I've stayed at? No. But I would have thought a major tourist destination like San Diego would go the extra mile to keep their customers coming back. We will look elsewhere the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: MaryIN
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered spacious, clean rooms; exceptional amenities and terrific value. The hotel itself is nicely appointed and the rooms were well maintained. The pool is adequate and the outdoor hot tub area is a real delight with comfy loungers and couches. Free full breakfast had lots of choices and the dining area was kept clean. The manager's reception in the evening was a real bonus - full bar from 5:30 to 7:30, including some tasty little microbrews that hit the spot after a day at the zoo or wild animal park. The location is right across from Seaport Village and just a few blocks from Horton Plaza/Gaslamp district. All in all, a really positive experience, supported by friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location. Seems better for young families than for others.”
Reviews.Author: SP100
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Embassy Suites in many cities. The suites are very nice and spacious. We love the 2nd sink and fridge. The Manager's Reception and hot breakfast are a very welcome touch. I was very surprised to find they charged $12.95 for WiFi! And our mattress kind of dipped in the middle. We are a couple in our 50s and were put on the 5th floor with a lot of young children. I would've preferred to be on a higher floor away from all the kids, if possible. Not a big enough issue for us to ask for a different room as we were there for only two nights. But the next time, we'll make a point of saying something about it.

Reviews.Title: “For families with children only”
Reviews.Author: HolaFlamenco
Reviews.Content: It is clear that this hotel is perfect for families with children. The breakfast and happy hour are okay, but I would prefer a less steep parking charge (makes for a lot of tipping, too), and at the very least, no charge for internet usage. The charge is $12.95 per computer. The hotel is noisy due to the trains and trolley and traffic and because there is a courtyard, there is an oppressive odor, not bad, but obvious, probably due to the indoor pool, too. The Rock 'n'Roll marathon was on while we were there so we were stuck until it was over because the streets were closed off. I am sure there is a less expensive, less noisy and cleaner hotel in the vicinity, we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: SuburbanHippie
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 3 kids (ages 7, 6 and 3) and found this hotel very much to our liking. The rooms are nice, clean and spacious although they could use updating. The kids loved the indoor pool, the jacuzzi and the free breakfast and manager's reception (there are soft drinks and snacks in addition to cocktails). We stayed on the 12th (top) floor and the kids adored the atrium and riding in the glass elevator. It's a bit distant from the Gaslamp Quarter, but there are plenty of bicycle-drawn carts waiting outside to offer to drive you there, and a short walk away is Seaport Village with restaurants, shops and a really cool vintage 1895 carousel. Only one caveat: Valet parking is mandatory and costs an extra $30/day (plus that's yet another guy you have to tip). Still, it's a much better deal than the more prestige, $$$$$ hotels in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: S708
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of a seven day trip to San Diego. I was very impressed with the hotel. The property was well maintained and all of the units were suites that included seperate living and sleeping areas. This is an ideal hotel to visit if you are traveling with young children. The rooms are nicely decorated and appear to have been recently remodeled with granite counter tops and new carpeting. Breakfast was included with the price of the room and I was impressed with the quality of the food and the convenience of being able to just step outside my door for breakfast. There is a heated indoor pool, which was ideal for families with kids. (San Diego can be cool at night making the indoor pool important). The location of the hotel is perfect since you are just a few blocks away from the Gas Lamp district and literally just a block away from Sea Side Village. I would not hesitate to book a room at this hotel especially if you are traveling with young children. The only drawback is that you have to pay an additional 29 dollars a day for parking, but other than that I thought the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: yam1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend, got in late afternoon on Friday and the manager's reception was even offered on Friday, not just Monday through Thursday. Front Desk was very nice, accommodated all our requests as we were checking in. We had a room on 11th floor, cannot complaint of any noise at all. We even kept our windows open during night. Great location, walking distance to everything: seaport village, gaslamp, night clubs, trolley. Parking fee is outrageous, like anywhere in San Diego, but the bell stand was very nice. I left a pair of shoes in the car, and he ran to the parking lot to get them for me. Enough mirrors for make up (there were 3 of us, all female), staying in the room, so having enough space to do make up and hair was important, that saved us a lot of time. Pool is nice, although weird that fitness and pool have a glass door, so people in fitness could watch me swimming, and vise versa, I guess Free breakfast, cannt beat that, great omeletts made to order. one of my friends, who flew to San Diego airport, found it very convinient that hotel had a display with all flights coming/outgoing from the airport. They also offer free shuttle to pick you up at the airport. I left an umbrella at the hotel, and they shipped back to me for free. I thought that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TechSMU
Reviews.Content: Stayed between Christmas and New Years with my wife and two young children. Hotel was just as advertised. Great location, friendly staff and fabulous breakfast. Would not hesitate to stay here again. If traveling with young children, this is THE place.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Rowie1
Reviews.Content: A great location, near the waterfront. We really enjoyed watching the changes on the water during the day, sunrises and sunsets from our harbour view room - well worth the extra. This is a standard Embassy Suite hotel, 2 room arrangement (lounge & bedroom). Beds were great, however rooms starting to date but clean and well maintained. Breakfast was great, not crowded at all. We really enjoyed the evening drinks, and found the staff to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Staff leaves a little to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Jmorris6b
Reviews.Content: Our room was standard Embassy Suites. There was construction going on while we were there but it was only a problem if you were in the lobby or trying to use the business center computers. The pool reopened the day that we left but looked very nice. The temporaily relocated fitness room had several pieces of equipment in good condition. The breakfast and the manager's reception were adequate but nothing special. The staff were either outstanding or bad. The concierge and the woman who checked me in were intelligent and went out of their way to be helpful. The free shuttle drivers both on the way from the airport and back were also very nice and helpful. On the other hand, the woman that was on the desk my first morning and the one who was on the next afternoon were to say the least not very helpful. The first morning I asked how to get to the trolley station [which the shuttle driver had pointed out as we were driving to the hotel] and she tried to tell me to go to a station where I woud have had to change trolleys and was only two blocks closer to the the hotel. She also told me that the station I wanted did not exist. The following afternoon I asked for information about taking the bus to the zoo. This woman proceeds to give me driving directions. I told her that I did not have a car; she says oh and proceeds to give me parking directions. When I finally got her to understand that I was interested in taking the bus she did not know how to find that information [easily obtained from the transit authority website]. She said that she would have the concierge call me with the info [concierge was gone for an hour]; she did not do so. When I talked to the concierge that night she was extremely helpful as well as the next night when I was interested in restaurants. The bartender, although not great at making drinks, was also very helpful in making recommendations for restaurants and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but crowded.”
Reviews.Author: Ducati40
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel during Christmas and had a great two bedroom suite. Spacious, clean and comfortable. No problem to get extra towels etc. But they did not have extra blankets. It was a cold period of year and for the one sleeping on the extra bed it would have been nice with an extra one! The beds have wonderful duvets. We were very satisfied with the room. 12 floor and briliant view over the bay. Breakfast in included and was good - cook to order etc. but the breakfast was overcrowded, they run out of stuff and the lines were long. The breakfast room was extremely cold, you had to wear your outdoor jacket. Probably not a problem during warmer periods! The managers reception is also crowded, with long lines. No food - just chips and popcorn is served. Not worth to wait for - go somewhere nicer! We did not use the pool or other facility. The location is great. You can walk almost everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: Anahid
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was OK. Rooms were clean with ample space. Breakfast was a nightmare - best described as 'cattle call' - crowded, unkept, and with rude employees. If you get to breakfast VERY early, I assume it's nice, but who wants to wake up at 6AM? After 8AM, forget it! There is empty trays and scraps. Certainly not what I would expect from an Embassy Suites. Also, good luck finding a place to sit and eat. Next time, I will stay at a less expensive hotel and eat breakfast at IHOP. Also, there is a mandatory valet fee for parking - around $20/day.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel choice for us”
Reviews.Author: CedarCreekQld
Reviews.Content: Following a stay at a great hotel at Anaheim, we headed down the coast to San Diego. I chose the Embassy Suites based on their website - I was looking for a hotel with a good location that had suite capacity for a family of four (we have two young children). We arrived at the hotel at night. Valet parking is very expensive and the set down/foyer area is noisy and chaotic. We had to wait for a while for check in and the atmosphere felt quite unfriendly and very impersonal. The hotel is set around a central atrium - our suite was on the second floor and the noise from the atrium was not pleasant. The rooms had a cheap and dated feel. Lots of chips in the furniture. The sofa bed had no sheets/bedding and was not made up. We requested room service and the burger was raw in the middle. Food was expensive compared to rest of our vacation experiences. I just felt very uneasy with the whole hotel and room environment. Not a comfortable atmosphere for us at all. Location wise, we ended up driving to Balboa Park area as the public transport seemed too long/multiple changes. We decided to check out after one night and stayed at a hotel at Carlsbad (about 30 minutes drive North) highly recommended by Trip Advisor reviews and thank goodness we did as that experience was much much better.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: Freeway12
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is beautiful and up to date. Staff and breakfast buffet were wonderful. Room was VERY HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT. Dingy and dated. If they remodel the rooms the hotel would be considered decent. Another disappointment is the balcony rooms! They aren't private. Two balconies are connected for 2 rooms. You can see the harbor from the balcony bay view room however, you still are overlooking an ugly parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Average and OK”
Reviews.Author: reichspot
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. We were a little disappointed there was construction going on. It was very loud sometimes with dust flying around the entire attium area. The room was clean and nice. The breakfast buffet was very good. Room service was fast and yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Embassy”
Reviews.Author: minerssa
Reviews.Content: This all suite hotel is very good value for money. As said before the breakfast and Managers reception is brilliant. Great choice of food to suit all tastes at breakfast and nothing too much trouble for staff. The location is very central for everything. I would recommend the Old Trolley tour, you can get from Seaport Village, this took you everywhere and the commentary was very informative. The Concierge at Embassy was very helpful as were the Shuttle drivers who even took us to the Car rental depot on our departure. Very good service all round. The rooms are spacious and well fitted out. The bed settee matress could have been a bit more comfortable but we were only there 3 nights so no real problems for my son and his girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Embassy Suites! Great Location! Highly Recommend this for families!”
Reviews.Author: hyperchickmom
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and we loved it even more! They are in process of renovating, although we thought it was just fine before! We asked for high floor cityview, and recvd 12th flr bayview! Breakfast is great! Manager's reception could be better...fritos, chips, ugh! More snack choices to go with drinks would be nice, but hey! its FREE~! We love this location, right across from harbor and seaport village. We did not have a car...So we took the Old Town trolley tour and got off and on at various stops! Another night we walked to Petco park to see baseball game! One day, we even took public transportation for a day to go to Mission Beach and Balboa Park! FUN! LOVE LOVE LOVE San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, But....”
Reviews.Author: yiyi + boys
Reviews.Content: I go to San Diego annually for the Comic-Con Convention and have stayed at this hotel twice so far. I like the proximity and convenience to the Convention Center and shopping. The room is nice and clean (somewhat). Since I travel with 2 boys, it's great that the rooms are equipped with a mini-fridge and microwave. The breakfasts are very good as compared to the other hotels, but it is VERY crowded. My one complaint is the shuttle service. It's unreliable. For the pickup from the airport, I wasn't able to get on the shuttle because it was full each time. Little did I know that because I traveled on JetBlue my pickup location was the last, therefore it was full both times. Frustrated I wound up spending money on a taxi. For the shuttle to the airport I was told to wait in the lobby 5 minutes before the hour. Ever so cautious we were in the lobby 15 minutes prior. We waited 20 minutes before I approached the front desk and was told that an announcement would be made shortly. Another 10 minutes passed before I approached the desk again. This time I was told to speak to one of the "men in the blue shirts." When I approached one of these men I was told that I would have to wait till the shuttle returns. Keep in mind that I have a flight to catch. When another guest, this time a male asked him, the "man in the blue shirt" told him of another shuttle that was available but there is no A/C. We all had flights to catch and it was a very cool 67 degrees outside. When the male guest said it didn't matter this "gentleman" took us to the airport. Was it because I was a female that the availability of another shuttle bus was not mentioned?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: paulrb48
Reviews.Content: Family of 4, on a 3 day stay after leaving a Cruise. Great location on the doorstep of both the downtown shopping and Seaport Village, and walking distance from bith the Cruise terminal and Amtrak - both of which we did with all bags ! Able to check in at 9.30am which was fantastic, receptionist also suggested we grabbed some free breakfast, despite the fact we weren't really entitled to it. All rooms are Suites, are spacious with settee, tables, TV area, as well as comfortable bedrooms and with great bay views. Clean and tidy throughout. Concierge very helpful and well informed, she got taxi fare exactly right for 2 journeys, and restaurant receommendations were spot on. Complimentary Breakfast and evening drinks were excellent, and it seemed were used by the whole hotel. The servers for both were really helpful and friendly We used the gym, business centre and flight check in facility, everything worked well and met our expectations. Highly recommended and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: arthanial
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2 night stay at the downtown embassy suites. I must say I enjoyed this site so much more than the la jolla site. I just thought everything about it was better. Obviously the location is better. But the service and the overall hotel quality just seemed more pleasant. the rooms were very comfortable and the hotel room was quiet.....despite being in a noisy environment. The hotel resaurant was great, but I'd advice not to place a to-go order at the restaurant......just don't do it. Get room service or eat in. The complementary breakfast and managers reception at embassy suites is certainly refreshing. Not many other hotels offer such hospitality at no cost.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, comfortable hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: HonestTravels
Reviews.Content: We moved from a resort and spa in San Diego after a terrible night stay to Embassy Suites. It mended a doomed vacation. The service was impeccable. We checked in quickly and smoothly. We were in the comfortable room in no time. The crib was there as requested, whereas other hotels, you have to call down three times to have it delivered. The manager's reception (AKA open bar) also catered to families with a disney movie and Cream Soda station on one end. The Nacho stand was a favorite for my three kids. The pool was indoor and never too crowded. The rooms were cleaned promptly and thoroughly. The breakfast lines moved quickly and if the atrium was crowded, they opened up more seating in the restaurant. There were three different people at the concierge desk and all were very helpful and truthful. The one time we didn't listen to the advise of the concierge, we regretted it and saw she was completely correct on her view of a particular restaurant. The valets were incredibly prompt and very professional. After a terrible terrible experience at another hotel the night before, embassy literally saved our vacation. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Baileybasset
Reviews.Content: We spent a Fri. & Sat. night at this hotel at the beginning of August. We redeemed our Hilton Honors points for the stay. We were able to check in upon arrival at 2 PM. The front desk staff was friendly both at check-in and check-out. The 7th floor City View room met our requests and the complimentary bottled water from Hilton Honors was delivered promptly. The shower was great and we did not have any plumbing problems experienced by an earlier reviewer. The air conditioning was fine and we set the fan to On to keep it running for a constant room temperature (the temperature seemed to go up at night when set to Auto). The maid knocked on the door about 9 AM the first morning, but we were about ready to leave, so it wasn't an inconvenience for us. Breakfast just after 8 AM on Sat. was very busy and chaotic with the many families present with children. We went at 7:30 AM on Sun. and it was much better. It costs $28/day to valet park in the hotel garage with in/out privileges. We did not use the car until we checked out and we walked easily to Seaport Village and the Embarcadero. We also walked to Petco Park on two nights and it was very safe with lots of people walking to & from the many hotels along the way. The Red Trolley also stops near the hotel and goes to Petco Park. If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs. The trolley and Amtrak can be noisy at night with the frequent whistles and crossing signals, especially in City View rooms. I've stayed at this Embassy Suites numerous times, and it has always been an overall satisfying experience. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Choice”
Reviews.Author: GloucsTraveller
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we visited on our trip from San Francisco to San Diego. We have used Embassy Suites before both on this trip and in Florida. This hotel was of a reasonable standard with the staff being polite and helpful and the facilities acceptable, although an outdoor pool would be better. It is situated within easy walk to the Gas lamp quarter and the restaurants and bars. The car parking is only Valet parking which is slightly annoying if you want easy and frequent access to your car, also a busy times it could be slightly chaotic in getting your car. Complimentary breakfast was excellent although again slightly chaotic at peak times. I had no major issues while staying at the hotel and would recommend it to fellow travellers looking for a reasonable hotel at a reasonable price. If you are looking for luxury and refinement this is not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: treeman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a business/pleasure trip. The hotel location was excellent - easy walking access to convention center, bay, gas lamp district, and naval ships. The area was also safe in the evening. The rooms were clean and maid service prompt. The complimentary full buffet breakfast was a great benefit. My only criticism was that the concierge was gone after 2 PM, and the front desk could not always address our questions. Overall, a very good hotel, however.

Reviews.Title: “Toilets optional”
Reviews.Author: leecypoo
Reviews.Content: After a ten hour car trip all the four of us wanted to do was use the bathroom. The first child went in and flushed. Then the next, no flush. No water. We were on the 11th floor. My husband went to the lobby to use that bathroom, same problem in the lobby. The toilets refill about once every 10-15 minutes. This went on the whole stay and there is no fixing it. The shower got stuck on hot and we couldn't change the temperature. Valet parking only, takes 20-30 minutes to retrieve your vehicle. For the price of more than $200 a night plus paying for the valet, I'd get two cheaper adjoining rooms next time anywhere with working toilets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Very poorly run.”
Reviews.Author: tboneps
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good: Location: Although some on here have complained about the location, it all depends upon what you are doing in the city. The hotel is walking distance to the marina, the seaport and all of its restaurants and shops, Horton Plaza, and the Midway. Yes, you will hear Amtrak. You will hear Amtrak from every downtown location, though. Views: Excellent. Our balcony overlooked the Coronado Bridge and the bay. It was beautiful, and we were able to watch the Fourth of July fireworks from there while the babies slept. It was terrific. Next, the 'mixed bag': Breakfast/Manager's Reception: The included breakfast and reception each evening adds a great deal of value to your stay. On Saturday, we couldn't enjoy either. The lines were wrapped all the way around the atrium, and there were no tables. Lines like that are no places for two year old twins. On Sunday, we knew better and went down to breakfast at 7AM. The lines were smaller, but still substantial. We did get a table and high chairs, though. The food is good, and there are healthy choices. The manager's reception on Sunday was not busy at all. We went down for sodas and some chips. A warning, though, chips and pretzels and drinks are all that is free during the reception. Some very bad pizza was $2 a slice (a decent price), but really inedible. And, the awful: I booked what is called the "Suite Shopping Package" after much review of all of the available rates. For our purposes, this provided the best value for our dollar. it was to include: 1. a 'Special Welcome Gift' at check in; 2. a $25 gift card per night to Westfield Horton Plaza; 3. a Starbucks Coffee Mug with a free Starbucks drink, and 4. complementary valet parking with full in and out privileges. The problem began at check-in when they had no idea what the "Suite Shopping Package" package was. I find this hard to believe, since it was customized for that particular hotel. If they had no idea, it is very poor planning and training. The person checking me in told me I would be charged an additional 28.99 per day for valet parking. I told her that it was included in the pkg. (and fortunately I had printed off the package details to take with me). She said, OK, I'll take care of that. I told her the other items could just be delivered to the room, but that we planned on using the Westfield gift cards for dinner that evening, so please don't delay it too long. About an hour before we planned to go to dinner, I called down to inquire. Oh, we'll send everything right up. They sent up a Starbucks mug and some coupons for discounts at various Westfield merchants. At this point, I decided to go down to the front desk. It took the gentleman 30 minutes and THREE different trips to 'talk to my manager' to get the gift cards. (Why on earth didn't the manager ever come out and deal with this directly?) Anyhow, I got the gift cards and told the agent that when they determined what the welcome gift is, just send it up. We're travelling with our infant twins, and this was really taking up too much time. The worst part of all of this is that I was made to feel like I was being petty or demanding. I was simply asking for (and I shouldn't have had to do that) what my rate promised me. I really did put a lot of research into the rates, and with the gift cards for dinner, the free coffee, and the free valet parking, this rate was less expensive than even the discount Internet rate. The welcome gift never materialized, and the valet charges - of course - were on the folio. I decided not to pursue the welcome gift, as it was just pointless and very annoying by this time. The valet charges were removed, but - again – it was yet another trip to the front desk. I would have phoned down to have the charges removed, but the phones in our room did not work on Sunday morning. I reported this from the house phone, but it was never fixed. This hotel has potential, but it is very poorly run. One final item: The swimming pool is on the first floor and just outside the four elevators. The floor in the elevator waiting area was always soaked with water from dripping swimsuits, and so were the floors of the elevators. During my lengthy time at the front desk, I heard two complaints to the front desk about this - including one from an elderly woman whose husband had fallen earlier in one of the elevators. She was told they hear this complaint often but there is nothing they can do. They will put up a 'wet floor' sign, though. Good grief, people. This is California. Can you say, "Lawsuit?" As I said, great potential, but not again for these travelers anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - a pretty good deal”
Reviews.Author: cuervoslammer
Reviews.Content: Checked in at the Embassy in June as an alternate site for a conference across the street at the Hyatt. Glad I did. Free breakfast, free happy hour large room that accomindated my family. All in all it was pretty good - for the price. Good location -walking distance to the gaslamp district. They gave us a room that hade a great view of the bay and overlooked the Midway. One nght there was fireworks and the view was great. If you are expecting a five star hotel, stay at the Hyatt across the street for a lot more money. If you are looking for great value the Embassy is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: dadair6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites following a less than adequate stay at another hotel on our honeymoom. I called the property directly after midnight to check on availability for the next day (4 night weekend stay). After I explained my predicament the woman who took my call told me she could put us in a Bay view room. When we checked in they put us on the top floor with a great view of the bay and Coronado Island. The staff was very helpful and cordial. The head valet even called pizza places for me after 11pm using his personal phone to check if they delivered. The added features of the hotel, complimentary manager's reception and hot, made-to-order breakfast are a nice touch and ones we took advantage of every day. The room was comfortable and clean with a microwave and refrigerator. The hotel is across the street from Seaport Village and the USS Midway. The Gaslamp Quarter is approximately a mile from the hotel, but very walkable. There is also a trolley stop a block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: hockibrat
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay for three nights. We have a 2 and half and 5 month baby, the suite was very comforatble, clean, and spacious. Beds and sheets were very comfy, view of the seaport great. The room faced west, good blackout curtains, so we enjoyed the room being darker in the morning. The complementary breakfast was extensive and we also enjoyed the manager's reception of free drinks and snacks in the early evening while the kids watched a video in the children's corner. My husband and son enjoyed the indoor pool. The front desk was helpful. The only negative is the overnight parking was expensive but they infomed us we could park on the street for less, appreciated the tip. Its walking distance to the trolley, seaport, gaslight district and baseball park which we enjoyed, especially since the weather was great. I was able to pick up milk and water in a little market adjacent to the hotel, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Bay View Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nice_hote_lover
Reviews.Content: Upon arrivial, valet/bellboys open out doors and took our luggage. Checkin was speedy and the clerks were very nice and honored my request of a high floor. The room was above average, large for a San Diego room. I would definatly recommened spening the extra $30 for a bay view room, because the view is awesome. The location of this hotel is also very good if you enjoy walkling to local attrations. They managers reception at night was AWESOME. FREE DRINKS...UNLIMITED! Lets just say the $300 room was almost paid for! The breakfast in the morning was packed, but still good. I would with out a doubt recommend this hotel if you are looking for a very nice bay side hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Same old hotel”
Reviews.Author: lite2shine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location many moons ago but I really don't remember the last time. What I remember is that the entrance to this hotel wasn't as crazy. Because the hotel stands at the corner of Harbor blvd and PHW, there is no entrance from PHW, so you have to turn right to Harbor first then make a u turn. This was annoying to me. The parking is valet only and it costs $30, but I guess other hotels charge pretty similar prices. The hotel itself is just another Embassy Suites. I was only staying one night so I didn't use any facilities. I would stay for a business trip again.

Reviews.Title: “Next San Diego visit will be in another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cyndie1230
Reviews.Content: Well our stay began with us walking into our room and the living room area remote would shut the t.v. off whenever you pushed a button and one of our lamps did not work. I called the front desk within minutes to report and they wanted to send up a technician (I thought another room offer would have been more appropriate). Then when we arrived there were 4 chairs at our table and suddenly one was gone (go figure what happened there.) We ordered room service the first night because we love the room service at the embassy suites in anaheim. This one has a restaurant in the lobby, Pacific Fish Company, the food was extremely dry we didn't order from them again oh and I should mention they do not serve fish and chips, huh? yea I didn't get that one. Maids come way too early! knocking at the door as early as 8:30 a.m., then, we were gone for 4 hours on that 2nd day and when we returned our room was not cleaned. The maid showed up at 3:00 I think it was we said no we just need towels which she gave to me promptly. Our TV was fixed when we were gone (I think this is when the chair went missing). The remote to the bedroom tv stopped working which made me mad. Next my daughters eyes were burning from the cholorine in the pool when I reported it they didn't really say much other than the pool was regulated which didn't make sense to me and they didn't offer anything for help once I bought eye drops to help then they offered eye wash. The dryer did not dry my clothes after a day at sea world and returning with wet clothes from sitting in the splash zones i spent an hour in the laundry area and my clothes were still wet. The best thing about this hotel was it was in the middle of everything! I loved the convenience and the bell boy (I think is what he was, got our bags put them in car, etc.) He was awesome. Gave us directions to everything we needed. He was very polite opened and closed doors for us. He was great and very informative. He just did a awesome job. We decided that our next visit will be either the Sheraton or Marriott which is in the same area this stay was soooooo disappointing. Too bad I liked embassy suites too, cause of the money we saved on breakfast but after our stay here I rather spend the money. I hope this helps you. For $300 a night and paying for valet parking at 28.00 a pop this should have been a better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: travelgal0808
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property several times over the last few years and have always liked it, which is why I kept going back. This past trip was a disaster! There was hair on the sheets of both beds when I checked in so I had to have the sheets changed because I knew they weren't mine. Then, I experienced the construction noise first hand. Management should really block rooms that are affected by the construction because it is very loud. I had to pack up all my stuff and have my room moved to another floor. Internet access was choppy at best. A few days later, I had a bad leak in the shower, which they couldn't fix. I intended to just deal with it but not only was the shower leaking bad but when you tried to turn it on, there was no pressure, so I had to move yet again. The third room I occupied had a broken alarm clock and problems with the tv. My keys de-activated, the clothes dryer wasn't functioning properly (took me three hours to dry one load of laundry) and I also had issues with the business center as well. Everyone apologized but at some point, words just didn't seem to help so I involved the manager, who gave me a gift certificate for a future stay. I got the feeling that the staff was so used to apologizing for problems, they really didn't try to address the issues and make the guest feel better about a bad situation. I was so frustrated that I could hold my tongue no longer. I told the manager that if I returned and had a similar experience that I'd rather just not come back at all, but he assured me that my experience was not the norm. I'd like to believe him. It's a shame that it had to get to that point though. I did have pleasant stays the last few times so I may give it another chance after the construction is complete but this past stay was just terrible. In good conscience, I just couldn't recommend this hotel at this time, which is a shame because it's a nice property in a good location. They just need to finish construction, maintain things better and get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, above average hotel, overall best value, comfy”
Reviews.Author: CreeksideNY
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews, but my stay at the Embassy has prompted it. Plus wanted to add to what I had read at this site prior to traveling to San Diego. Agree...this is probably one of the best hotels I've stayed in while not paying $$$$ for it. I would rate above average to excellent. We really enjoyed our stay. We requested a bayview room...we were given a corner room on the 7th floor with great views of the Seaport Village and Harbor. For the most part...I thought our room was very quiet and private. Our room was clean, spacious, had a bar sink, microwave and small fridge in the galley area. It had a working desk or table in the livingroom for your laptop or if you wanted take-out one night. What I liked about our room was the big huge sink area in the bath AND one outside the bathroom. This way, my husband had one area, I had on area for our "stuff." Yes, there is some very minor evidence that the Embassy is currently renovating their rooms. But I do not think you would notice this unless you are on the upper floors and you are deciding to take an afternoon nap at between 1-3 p.m. We did this one day..there was only a very faint tapping to be heard. The only other way we knew there was some construction going on at this hotel was reading about this on this website and a small discreet sign in the elevator. I have read here and agree...the beds are VERY comfortable and LOTS of really good fluffy pillows. I see complaints were written about the noise of the a/c or heat. I did not notice the noise of the fan more than any other hotel I have been in. Comments on the free breakfast buffet and a happy hour (snacks and drinks). The breakfust buffet is a real value-add considering that eating an equivalent breakfast out might run you about $15pp. Also the Embassy breakfast is probably better than you can get at any Hampton Inn or similar type of hotel that includes a continental breakfast. You can have an omelet made to order...which is more than I have seen offered elsewhere. Now...here's the catch. Get there early if you are aggravated by crowds or people who think that the food will all of a sudden dissappear or that the Embassy will shut down the breakfast area without notice and they will be out of luck. I think you know what I mean. You still get A LOT of people who think that because it's "free," means they can behave as though it is a "free-for-all." The Embassy must have about 7-8 people , possibly more, working the lounge/breakfast area , keeping it clean, clearing tables, and keeping it "fresh." We went about 7:30 daily and it was a bit hectic and somewhat aggravating for us. Once seated and away from the hordes, you can somewhat relax but it is always difficult for my husband and I to relax while watching people act like it is their last meal. We went earlier on our last day and it was pleasant. None of the craziness. I cannot say enough about how polite and courteous the staff and breakfast crew is. Now about the manager's reception: no biggie. We went downstairs to check it out and decided to pass. Well liquor and nachos and some "freezer" pizza. Save your calories and don't risk any headaches with the well-liquor. Granted it's a nice idea...but not for my husband and I. There is a charge for WiFi [$9.95 per day]. If you can get by without your own laptop in your room, you can use the business center, internet is free. Okay..so you think that the WiFi charge is a bit much? Well...the Embassy makes it up with the free breakfast. [Go outside and order an omelet and see how much that will cost you! ] I did not experience the connectivity issues that others had commented about. The WiFi worked flawlessly. The pool and jacuzzi is average to small size, but the their gym is a treat with treadmills, elipticals and dumbell weights. One of the nicer hotel gyms I have seen for this class hotel. This hotel is 15 min walk from Gaslamp, 1/2 block from their trolley, 10 min walk to the harbor excursions and Seaport Village. Starbucks is attached to hotel downstairs. Some comments on the hotel's Pacific Fish Company restaurant. The PFC will mostly seat people in the bar area, which is noisy and cold. For some reason the air conditioning is cranked in there. The sushi is mediocre at best. My husband had sushi there one night and it didn't look so hot...kind of amateurish (we eat A LOT of sushi). That made me reluctant to try any of the fish. They have a smoked beef salad which is to die for. The Martha's Vineyard Salad is also very good. The food is overall very good tavern/bar food. Again, service is excellent and waitstaff professional. There are so many places to eat in San Diego that I would say there is no need to add this restaurant to your list as "must dine here." I will say that the restaurant is convenient if you come back in late from a day of touring or whatever and you are too tired to venture out much further. You can get a decent meal. A comment..this restaurant also serves the hotel room service. The prices for room service are at least $1.00 more per item, there is a $3.00 room service fee and they add 19% gratuity to the bill. There is clearly stated on the room service menu. Parking is $28 a day without any in/out fee. Now stop acting like this is a big deal. Guess what ? You are in the city. Parking is expensive ANYWHERE and most of the hotels are charging $25 to $30 a day. [I did all this research before I went.] One note, we are not 100% sure but we think one of the valets possibly scratched our rental. We did notice until the vehicle was at Avis and they pointed it out. That can happen with any valet service, just be aware. One review commented on crazy/rude busboys and valets who were falling over themselves to get tips. We did NOT see this. Again, the valets were all very pleasant and extremely polite...as were the rest of the staff. My last few comments. The train!! When reading the reviews about the Hampton Inn and Holiday Inn Bayside...I got a bit freaked out because people were commenting the fact that you can hear the train all night long. Guess what? We heard the train as well in our hotel. Talking to some locals, they indicated EVERYONE who lives or stays downtown can hear the the train at night. Someone even commented that it is some age old agenda by Amtrak with the City of San Diego. We didn't hear the train Sunday night, but did hear it through the week. We got used to it. So be prepared! I chose this hotel because it was slightly less expensive than the Manchester Grand Hyatt and I wanted a suite style room. I walked over to the the Manchester to check it out. It is A LOT more plush and caters to business people and older traveling couples. You will pay for this though. Also, parking is $30 per day there. But looking at the Manchester Grand Hyatt and relation to the train tracks...I am sure they hear the train at night as well. Overall, we had a fantastic experience at The Embassy Suites...will be returning here. ONE MORE THING: Go to the Fish Market Restaurant (near the USS Midway Museum) and eat at The Top of the Market. You might think pricey but it was FAB and worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but stay away from the construction”
Reviews.Author: Sights2C
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it - 2-room suites with comfortable beds, an abundance of nice fluffy pillows, an amazing array of free breakfast offerings, nightly happy hours with drinks made-to-order, and a prime location across from Seaport Village. Unfortunately, after over a year of renovations, the construction continues. And I found out from experience on my most recent stay, you do NOT want to be in the room next door. The hammering next door started around 7:30 in the morning, and continued through till around 6 pm. Forget about a nice relaxing hour or two in the room before going to dinner. If you're in the proximity of a suite undergoing renovation you're not going to get it. I met other guests in the elevator who were having the same problem, so this wasn't an isolated incident. My previous stay at the hotel was wonderful, but the noise was a major problem and ruined what would have been an otherwise perfect stay. If you're making reservations here, I'd recommend that you specify that your suite is nowhere near a construction zone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Type-A_Planner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites during a five-day conference. It served as the perfect place for an extended stay: -a complimentary hot breakfast bar available in the morning -a manager's reception in early evening -a short walking distance to the convention center (10 minute walk), restaurants, shopping -10-min. drive from the airport -a door separating my bedroom from any activity in the hallway (my favorite aspect) I was really pleased with my stay. Often extended hotel stays during conferences make me feel cooped-up and trapped in my hotel room - the suite set-up was a great comfort and helped me feel like I wasn't living out of my suitcase. For me, the most important aspect of a hotel is being able to sleep without interruption - Embassy Suites ensures this. This is where I plan on staying next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, OK food, easy to get everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Debbie in Maryland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here spring break 2008 (late March) and saw no evidence of construction. My son enjoyed the nintendo on the TV, but I was disappointed to find out we had to pay for it; internet access also cost $10/day. It wouldn't hurt to provide these for free. The suite feature is nice, but the sitting area only has a window overlooking the elevator bank in our room (404). The bedroom overlooked the bay and was worth the $314 that we paid for the room (AAA rate). Everything was clean and well maintained in our room (except the air return for the AC made noice). The microwave and fridge are good features, as were the pull out sofa and desk in the sitting area. I loved sitting on the balcony overlooking the bay and Coronoda Bridge. We had a perfect view of Seaport Village from our 4th floor rooms. Housekeeping button on the phone doesn't work. Wonder why they don't forward those calls to the operator?? We enjoyed the free manager's happy hour each evening. Free drinks (mixed drinkis, beer, wine, and sodas). Also free chips and cheese dip. Don't pay $2 for the pizza slices - my son wouldn't touch them either time I bought him a slice (and he loves pizza). A hot breakfast buffet is included in the rate. Pretty decent food. The omelets were not as good as I hoped, but the fried eggs and bacon were very satisfying. Good variety of cereals, pasteries, eggs, meats, and fruits are put out. The coffee was only OK, so I went to the Starbucks attached to the hotel each morning for my fix of caffeine. Don't order from the hotel restaurant - Pacific Fish Company. We ordered dinner at 8:15 pm on a Sunday night (Easter Sunday). It took them 45 minutes to delivery our cold, overcooked dinner. They were out of cheese cake, so we got carrot cake and creme brulee. The carrot cake was "factory made" and the creme brulee was overcooked. The crab cakes were made from dry, stringy crab that got stuck in my teeth and weren't worth finishing. The corn salsa was very good. My son wouldn't touch his mac and cheese, saying they were terrible. The ice cream had melted a lot before it got here. And the best part - 20 hours after we put the trays outside of our room they were still there. Everyone getting off of the elevators on the 4th floors got to see what we left on our plates from our disappointing dinner the night before. Needless to say, we won't be eating there again. But we would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bay views, and front desk help!”
Reviews.Author: mr88oh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is currently finishing bathroom renovations, which follow other renovations made to the property. If making a reservation, be sure to ask for a room on the top two or three floors--far away from the work. Rooms on the bay side have fabulous views and I recommend booking one of those even if there is a premium charged. Hot items in the complimentary breakfast are hot, and cold items are cold. The breakfast is full and one couldn't ask for a better one. Crowding and lines were not a problem, and I didn't go to breakfast early. The evening manager's "happy hour" is a delight. I had a problem with the first room I was given, but the front desk staff put me in a second room (which was acceptable) and promised to move me the next day to a better room--which they did, and it was. They couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The hotel is convenient to the shops and restaurants of Seaport Village, and about a 10 minute walk to the Gaslamp district. In short, it's conveniently located. I do wish that there was an outdoor area on the hotel property to enjoy the beautiful San Diego weather. This hotel is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “best hotels I've stayed in while not paying $$$$”
Reviews.Author: crusaderS510
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best hotels I've stayed in while not paying $$$$ for it. The rooms are clean, spacious, has a bar sink, microwave and small fridge. Embassy is currently renovating their rooms. We stayed in one of the older rooms and because of the stench of smoke asked to be changed to new room. Embassy was kind and immediately switch us to the new room. The newer rooms have new carpets and new bathrooms. All furniture is the same as the old. Water pressure was very strong and when I dropped huge logs in the toilet, it was strong enough to get those suckers down the drain! Newer counter tops make it easy to lay your personal things. The best part was the bedroom. There is a separate entrance which blocks the noise from the atrium. The bed was heavenly and the comforter, which looked thin, kept us very warm at night. If we had our family, they would have enjoyed the (2) TV's, free breakfast buffet and a happy hour (snacks and drinks). There is a charge for WiFi, but if you use the business center, internet is free. The pool and jacuzzi is average, but the their gym is a treat with treadmills and dumbell weights. This hotel is 15 min walk from gaslamp, 1/2 block from their trolley, 10 min walk to the harbor excursions and seaport village. Starbucks is conveniently located 5 steps away from the hotel. Also this hotel offers free pick up and return to SD airport. Lastly, there is a $25/day parking fee for your vehicle. Opps I forgot to mention, the staff here is very friendly and helpful. I will make sure to visit here again! ***Do's*** -carry a SD map with you (free at concierge) -Visit gaslamp, little italy -eat at Filippi's, Hash House, Blue Point restaurants -blue and red line trolleys -walk, run or jog the harbor, beautiful sight and real fresh air ***DONT's*** -use the embassy concierge, she is old and useless. never at her post. -unless you like the ocean, Whale watch ~ sea sick; uggh! -orange line trolley (it will take you to the very bad parts of SD) -Horton Plaza, better off at gaslamp for shopping -DONT pay for trolley, conductor never checks for tickets

Reviews.Title: “Simply great!”
Reviews.Author: Karni
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but we had such a great experience at this hotel that I felt that I owed it to them to tell readers how wonderful it was. I really think that the 'motto' at this hotel is to make the customer happy at any cost! Everyone, from the chef, to the front desk staff, to the bell boy made an effort to make sure we were satisfied. Especially Andrew, one of their managers, made sure that all of our needs were met... We travel a lot, and I have never met a nicer group of people at a hotel. In addition, the hotel is perfectly located in downtown, minutes from the Gaslamp and 3 blocks from the Trolley that can take you anywhere in the city. The hotel is great for kids and adults alike. They are remodeling the rooms which will make it even nicer, but they make sure that construction doesn't disturb the guest.. so don't worry about that. They have a great indoor pool for kids, and a Pacific Co. restaurant and Starbucks on site.. which is very convenient. We are extremely picky and I really cannot say enough good things about this place. Don't think twice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: griswalds5
Reviews.Content: my family and 3 other families decided to stay for New Years Eve, what a great Idea. We were able to walk to dinner, the kids were able to swim due to the indoor pool and the breakfast was pretty good. The bay view was a plus as we were able to see fire works at midnight from our window. We would definitely do this again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Elijah
Reviews.Content: We had a generally pleasant stay in this Embassy Suites while attending a conference at the Convention Center, about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. The conference rate was $199/night. The hotel is on the trolley line and close to gas town and seaport shops and restaurants. The rooms are pretty much the standard for Embassy Suites, sitting room plus bedroom plus bath. We enjoyed the space. Though the room decor was rather old and dated, the suite was clean. Breakfast was standard American fare, but included omelets cooked to order. The afternoon offered wine, beer, soft drinks, popcorn, pretzels, etc. We had a problem with the cold water tap in the bath which did not work. It took three tries to get someone to take care of it. Fortunately because there was another sink in the room we did not suffer too much inconvenience, but I wrote a complaint about he slow response. Our expectations were not high after reading some of the reviews, but aside from the water tap we thought the stay was above average at a four or 3+ star level.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: WeightWatchers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeklong visit to San Diego and Las Vegas. My husband and I visited San Diego first to celebrate my birthday. I am so happy we chose the Embassy Suites Downtown. We loved the location, and we found the rooms to be wonderful and so spacious. Our room had beautiful wood furnishings that appeared to somewhat new. I really believe Embassy Suites should be on the top of the list for families. Each suite has two large rooms and a large bath. The first room has a sleep sofa, TV in a cabinet and a large dining room style table. I enjoyed being able to spread out and not confined to one room. The breakfast was just so delicious. The hotel provided plenty of good food for everyone. We really looked forward to it each day. The complimentary afternoon reception was a lot of fun, too. The hotel's atrium is just so fascinating. I loved the live fish in the ponds. I noticed that it was a big draw for kids. I loved the proximity the hotel was to a lot of San Diego attractions, i.e. shopping, the Gas Lamp neighborhood, Seaport Village, and many other sightseeing activities. We really loved being across the street from the Seaport Village. It is directly located on San Diego Bay, so it was so wonderful to walk along the shore and look out at the bay. There are many great places to eat nearby, especially at the Seaport Village. Also, the city transit train is just around the corner. The staff at the hotel were so helpful to us. My husband uses an electric scooter. The valet staff readily helped us get the scooter in and out of our rental car. My husband and I both agree that his hotel will be our choice each time we visit San Diego. In fact, we are already planning for another visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, accomodationsl so, so”
Reviews.Author: outtoplay
Reviews.Content: We checked in to a very pleasant lobby with an atrium equipped with a pond of Koi that my children enjoyed feeding. Upon arriving in our room we noticed the walls were "beat up". They had black marks and scratches all over. The room was very roomy, as it had a living room that was nice sized. The bathroom was extremely dated and pretty dirty. The floor length mirror had mold up and down it and my 5 yr. old son was bouncing off the walls so I was stressed the whole time that he would touch the molding mirror. I shouldn't have to be stressed about something like that. Other then the black marks all over the walls, the dirty bathroom, and the molding mirror, the room was very nice, until nighttime when we tried to get sleep. The air conditioner did not have a happy medium and was extremely noisy. Sounded like an airplane just outside the window all night. We took turns getting up all night changing the temp of the air for comfort since it couldn't figure itself out and we were kept up anyways with the noise. The pool was indoors and I think that is why it was so cloudy and dirty from no air circulation and I didn't want my kids to go in, but how do you tell kids they can't swim when there was a pool full of kids and hot weather. Breakfast was included everyday and that was fantastic!!! It was a full on buffet with almost everything you can imagine. I read some reviews here that stated they wished the breakfast had more choices. I can't imagine where they eat...the choices were plentiful!! It gets very crowded on the weekends for breakfast so I suggest go early. They do open the fish restaurant for extra seating and are very accomodating during breakfast making sure you are comfortable. Breakfast is served in the atrium so the kids can get up and feed the Koi when they are done while we relaxed with our coffee. My kids loved renting games on the t.v. which you paid for by the hour. We also rented a movie which was fun and we could spread out in the living room one night with popcorn and sodas. The room had a microwave so we brought our own popcorn. Room service has a special for a large pizza and 4 sodas at a great price too. The sushi on the room service was excellent too. The location is terrific. We walked to Seaport Village and shopping downtown. It would have been a perfect weekend if the room was clean and I wasn't stressed about the dirtiness so we did talk to the front desk upon check out and their only response was "we know, that's how most of our rooms are, next month we are remolding the entire hotel one floor at a time". No apologies or compensation, which was a shame since word gets around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, loved the free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Parklandmom
Reviews.Content: What we liked - Great free breakfast (get there early to avoid the crowds). Great location, across from Seaport Village. Very helpful concierge. Room was clean and comfortable. Improvement needed - Room was comfortable, but could use an update. 1st night asked for extra pillows, never received them. Asked again the next day, finally received them. Fee for valet parking too high! I would stay here again and recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandTrip
Reviews.Content: Came her with wife, 3 year old and 2 month old infant over Aug. 24-26 weekend. We had a great time. It's PERFECT for families. I've stayed at a few different Embassy Suites and while all are good for families, this was the best in our experience. Both the manager's reception (serving not only beer and wine but mixed drinks) and breakfast were even better than the other Embassy Suites. As usual, the rooms are all suites. As our son is older and we now have the infant, we actually had to use the living room pull out sofa bed and it was surprisingly comfortable. Didn't have a single complaint. Advice to those reserving city view rooms...train tracks are pretty close so request a room on a higher floor and the noise from the trains shouldn't bother you (didn't bother us - 7th floor).

Reviews.Title: “They Stole My Ipod!”
Reviews.Author: rlfl
Reviews.Content: While at a convention in San Diego my iPod was stolen from my room. The concierge acknowledged that staff had been in the room the hotel's liability carrrier refused my claim. DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU VALUE YOUR BELONGINGS! Another convention attendee lost her purse while at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Conference - expensive but great location”
Reviews.Author: woodie12
Reviews.Content: We came to San Diego for a large conference at the Convention Center - great location for access to the conference and events at nearby hotels. Rooms are large with separate living area - my husband could stay up whilst I slept when I could (it was a busy week). Breakfast was great - everything from cereal and fruit, bacon, eggs and donuts! Busy (school holidays) but we were always able to find a seat. It was an easy walk to Seaport for dinner, or into downtown to see the baseball or restaurants and shopping. The trolley runs past the door, so easy access to everything. Evening manager drinks were well managed and nice to finish off the day. Overall, good location with no complaints - but more expensive than anywhere else we stayed in the USA including LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ssreddy
Reviews.Content: Great location at a great price! Booked a city view room, but was given a bay view room without even asking! What more can I say!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location family hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwoo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in San Diego with a toddler and infant. This hotel is at a great location. It's about 8 min walk to Seaport Village where there are lots of restaurants and shopping. It's about a 15 min drive to the zoo and Seaworld. There's a grocery store, Ralph's, that's about 10 min drive from the hotel. The room has a mini fridge and microwave so we bought some milk, juice, and snacks. Also if you're there over the 4th of July or New Year's, ask for the rooms with a balcony facing the Navy ship. There aren't many with a balcony. If you get one (we stayed in room 921), you can see the fireworks from your balcony. The complimentary hot breakfast was very convenient with children. The extra living room was helpful too as we put our toddler in the bedroom with us and our infant in a crib in the living room. That way if one woke up in the middle of the night, he didn't wake the other up. Also one child can nap in the bedroom during the day while the rest of the family can be in the living room. Downside of staying downtown is that parking is only valet for $24/day. That's not including tip, if you desire. Since we were there over the holiday, many times it took the valet service 20 min to pull up our car. You can call ahead from your room most of the time. Sometimes if they were too busy, they wouldn't pick up the phone so it would be a pretty long wait downstairs with children. Overall, we were happy with the hotel and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Would Reccomend”
Reviews.Author: meyouandfamilytoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in June 2007. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. This included the men that picked us up (and dropped us off) at the airport in the free shuttle, the man who delivered room service, the consierge, the front desk staff, and the woman that helped me carry my tray at breakfast while my toddler tugged at my body. The breakfast has a wide variety of items and you are able to have eggs prepared to your liking. There is also a free manager's reception in the evening. Our suite was on the large size. It was a corner unit and I believe these may be bigger than the other rooms. It had a king size bed in one room and in the other room our son slept on the pull-out sleeper sofa. There is not much to the kitchenette area. The room itself could use a little updating (some wallpaper was hanging off the wall and the style was slightly dated.) Overall, it was very clean just a little boring decor. The room definitely had the feel of a business hotel. Besides recommending the room to someone visiting San Diego on business, I would recommend it to a variety of other people as well. There certainly were plenty of families visiting the weekend we were there. The location is very good for exploring downtown. Across the road is the village area with shops and restaurants, marina and aircraft carrier. The convention center is close by. It took us about 15 minutes to walk to Petco Park and it was pretty much a straight line. The dowtown train is easy to catch and makes exploring other areas like Old Town really easy. You can also walk to get the amtrak and coaster trains to North County. Since the trains pass nearby all of these downtown hotels you may want to keep your windows closed at night. The location of the hotel was really good if you don't have a car. I believe it is $25. a day to park your car. The indoor pool appeared nice but small and I did not see anyone using it. In general, it wasn't the best $250. a night we ever spent but it suited our needs and perhaps it may work for you as well.

Reviews.Title: “Aggressive Bellboy, Great View”
Reviews.Author: family4MI
Reviews.Content: Our experience started off on a really bad note. We arrived with a van full of stuff after traveling for a week down from San Francisco. My son found a cart and we began sorting through what we wanted to leave in the van and what we wanted take up to the room. A bellman name Iniega appeared and told us we had his cart. We told him that we did not need his assistance and were still deciding on what more to take up to the room. He preceded to remove our items from the cart and placed them on the ground. As he walked away with the cart, I asked him if that was really how he wanted to treat a Hilton Gold Member. He shoved the cart at us and walked away. As we reloaded our suitcases back on the cart, another bellboy appeared. He just stood there claiming the cart until we were done. It was quite uncomfortable for us. A hotel customer should have a choice as to whether they need assistance with their luggage. The carts should be available with the room just like the pool, fitness center and other amenities. We wondered if they had a shortage of carts and that's why the bellboys were so aggressive, but as we ate our breakfast sitting across from the gift shop, we watched the bellboys wheel the carts in and out of a locked room filled with carts. The bellboys just want to make those tips whether it makes the guest uncomfortable or not. The hotel itself has a beautiful view, nice breakfast & manager's reception, but small pool. It is a pleasant walk to the bay and a shopping center along the water.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay at Embassy Suites Downtown”
Reviews.Author: shanloraine
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to San Diego last week for business, and I decided to stay a couple days extra for sight-seeing. I decided to stay at the Embassy Suites Downtown after extensive research, and I based my decision on location, price, and amenities. The location was good, across the street from Seaport Village, the U.S.S. Midway, and about six blocks from the Gaslamp District. The walk to the Gaslamp District seems safe (which was important to me, since I was a 25-year-old woman traveling alone), although I only walked it before sunset. There are fewer pedestrians the closer you get to the hotel, but the area seems safe and frequented by locals taking their dogs to the dog park I passed. Technically you could walk to the zoo and Balboa park (apparently it takes about 45 minutes), but since my ankles were giving me problems I took a cab, as recommended by the hotel’s concierge. It was convenient, but expensive. It was about $12 each way. This might be more worthwhile if you aren’t the only one in the cab like I was. The price for my room (I paid about $230 per night, including tax) is expensive for one person, but would be a great deal for a family, especially with the complimentary breakfast. I had good experiences both days I ate breakfast in the lobby. The lobby is pleasant to sit in, decorated in foliage and goldfish ponds. The size of the breakfast area is the biggest I’ve seen in a hotel that serves a free breakfast; usually I have to fight for the toaster and squeeze around other bodies standing around trying to get their food. Not so here. And the selection was very good with hot items like pancakes and eggs, donuts, cereal, toast, bagels, hot chocolate, juice, and fresh fruit. Not being a coffee drinker, I especially liked the hot chocolate that is machine brewed and comes out frothy, plus they provide cinnamon, vanilla, and creamer to add to it (maybe it was meant for the coffee, but oh well). Lastly, I was so surprised by the good service of the employees manning the breakfast! Both days someone asked me if I had everything I needed. On the second day I asked the lady for another box of cereal and milk, and she brought it right out so I could continue reading the paper. The room is large, and for one person felt luxuriously spacious. I liked being able to lounge on the couch or in bed to watch TV, and I’m glad the window opened to let in fresh air. There’s a vanity with sink outside the bathroom in addition to the sink and counter space in the bathroom. Overall I felt safe staying here. I was never impressed by the service or friendliness of the front desk employees, but everyone else I encountered were more professional (like the housekeepers and the bellboy). The biggest annoyance I encountered is that they’re remodeling the fitness room to make it bigger, and the noise of the construction (which they start around 10 and continue until about 4 or 5) was super loud! My room was on the same side of the hotel as the construction—but six floors up! And I could hear the construction as if it were just one floor below me. One afternoon I returned to the hotel for a nap after a busy morning, but I found the noise was so bad that I asked the front desk if I could move rooms or something so I could get some rest. As I said before, none of the front desk employees impressed me much at all, but I do give the girl a tiny bit of credit for finally offering me earplugs, which I accepted. On the bright side, a larger exercise room will be good for future guests, since it was inadequately small before…but I wish I could have used it myself and that it wasn’t so noisy through the day.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: elasticgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our two kids ( 2 & 6) stayed her April 6-14. We had a large, bayside corner room on the fourth floor. The bedroom had a king size bed and plenty of storage space, the living room was a nice size with a pull out sleeper sofa. The bar area had a sink, microwave, refrigerator and a large table. The windows opened enough to let some fresh air in. When traveling with children a complimentary breakfast is a must have amenity. The variety and quick and efficient service was much appreciated. The earlier you go the less crowded it is, but even then you don’t have to wait too long. The eating area was clean and offered two points of interest to the kids. First are the well fed fish in the ponds and then the turtle house where you can see the occupants taking a sun bath before diving in to join the fish. We ordered room service several times and while it wasn’t outstanding my kids ate the chicken tenders and mac and cheese like it was their first time. The sushi and sandwiches are good choices. I do agree the front desk staff is not very friendly or helpful but the concierge and the valet parking attendants are great. One valet even ran back to my car (which he just parked) to get my cell phone and delivered it to my room. Very nice. Two complaints: there are only two washers and dryers in the entire hotel; two are on the 11th floor and two on the 12th floor. There are no change machines and often the soap dispenser (only one on 11?) is empty which means a trip to the lobby. This also meant NUMEROUS trips between floors checking for availability. The pool area often lacked dry towels and the chlorine was an eye killer. Very strong, but I guess that’s a good thing in a hotel pool. The location was fantastic, right across the street from Seaport Village( try the carousel), a couple blocks from the USS Midway and Maritime Museum( five kinds of sailing vessels you can tour, not crowded and kid pleasing). We had friends staying at the Marriott who were awakened every hour by passing trains. We slept like babies. Traveling with children can be a nightmare if the hotel isn’t compatible to your needs. This one offered us plenty of space, quick access to meals, and a great location for walking with a stroller.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!! After seeing room we left!”
Reviews.Author: Bunky67
Reviews.Content: Wow where do I start? Our family just returned last night from a trip to San Diego. We were staying at the Double Tree Hazard Center Hotel....what a place! My husband had made reservations over the weekend at Embassy Suites Downtown. What a mistake! The kids and I went there to ck in. We were early. The hotel front desk was very cold to us....rude. When we finally did get to ck in. The top floor room we had been told was reserved for us (I called the day prior to ck in) was not available mysteriously! So we got a room on the 11th floor. We walked into the room and it smelled very very strong of smoke odor, like someone had just smoked a cigarette! I was shocked. The bathroom door had a huge area that had been punched...and never fixed. Like someone had punched the door and it was broken in all around the fist area. I was again shocked for what we were paying that a hotel would look this way. We had been to the restaurant area as well earlier and it was very unkept with food on the floor I had to walk around. I was not impressed! It all made such an impression on me I called the mgr and cancelled our reservations and left. Never a "I am so sorry" or anything from the staff. Very cold.....I would never stay here! I have stayed at much lower class hotels with wayyyy better service and amenities. Oh also pool is small and inside. Not a nice area like the Doubletree Hazard Center. This hotel is overrun with people too. If you want a quieter and much much nicer property for much less price with TWO pools and a wonderful outdoor hot tub....stay at the Double tree Hazard Center! You will NOT be sorry! I just wish I had taken photos of this place! Please take my word for it.....people who have given good reviews of this hotel....don't know if they stayed at the same place or not? Perhaps it has changed???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family atmosphere!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: familyminded
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 young children, ages 5 and 2 years of age. We live in Orange County and often visits San Diego (at least once a month). We love this establishment! This is the only place that we love! We stayed here quite often and have always had great experiences with the whole service. The staff is very friendly, breakfast is so yummy, and my husband can't get enough of the manager reception hours. It is in walking distance from everything and is very safe. We stayed at other establishments but this is always and will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bedogged
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. Our party consisted of three older women including one in a wheelchair and one using a cane. The staff was the friendliest I have ever seen. They couldn't do enough to help and always smiled and recognized you when they saw you. Our room was what you would expect, not new, but certainly nothing wrong with it. We had a great view of the harbor. It was very clean and housekeeping was very good. If you had a problem, it was corrected inside of 30 minutes. This hotel knows customer service. Breakfast was good and we took advantage of the free happy hour. The atrium was beautiful. I would fault this hotel if we had been using a car. It was $24.00 a day just to park. Our party did not have one so that was not an issue for us. They do have a free shuttle to and from the airport. Location is great, right across the street from Seaport Village and the Midway. Even with a wheelchair, it was close enough to explore and expand dining opportunities. We did dine once at the hotel restaurant. It was very good, but a bit pricey for what you got. Our party has already made plans to return to this hotel next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: phoenixtravelerlover
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Travelocity with our flight. They had an airport to hotel shuttle available and the hotel was within walking distance of several attractions (Seaport Village, USS Midway, Maritme Museum, etc.), as well as Horton Plaza and Ralph's grocery store. The hotel room was large and there was enough room in the living room/dining room area that we were able to set up the Pack-N-Play without tripping over it. There was also a pull out couch available that when pulled out did not take up a lot of space. The room had a great view of the bay from both the bedroom and the living room. The hotel provided breakfast everyday as part of the package. A choice selection of items was available on a daily basis and was much appreciated. The hotel also had a Starbucks and restuarant available. The room service menu was extensive and the service was fairly quick. The hotel was helpful and friendly.
