The hotel itself was clean and well sited. The hotel was kid-friendly and while there were a lot of children there it is also well suited to someone without kids. We will stay here again on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A very fun experience”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTravelers5
Reviews.Content: The morning complimentary breakfast was very tasty, with many choices. Location was convenient to Seaport village, airport, USS Midway, Petco park, the bay, harbor tours, and the convention center. Our room was clean and spacious. All of the employees were helpful and nice. Pacific Fish Co. was very tasty. Nearby train and traffic was sometimes noisy but usually not a problem. Happy hour was enjoyable. We only saw one bird in the eating area/atrium but it wasn't a problem. Great hotel for families of 5 or more - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: minimomma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Embassy Suites over Christmas of 2006. We've stayed at other Embassy Suites on several occasions, and I must say, I was disappointed. Our room was in serious need of remodeling. Wallpaper was peeling of the walls, grout was missing in between the bathroom tiles, and the unit the refrigerator rested in looked like termites had attacked. The bathroom cabinet and the furniture had huge dents and nicks which where so obviously painted over. In addition to this, it took 2 calls to maintenance before they finally came and repaired the handle on the bathroom door which was about to fall off. The beds where small (full size) and no attempt was made to make them even look inviting. I attempted to do a load of laundry on the 11th floor, but the smell coming from the trash can was so awful, we quickly moved to the 12th floor. There are only 1 washer and 1 dryer on these 2 floors. Most disappointing was all of the birds flying around in the hotel and looking for scraps of food on the floor in the breakfast area. This was not sanitary in my opinion. The hotel is in a good location and the staff was great. Across the street is Seaport Village. You can also purchase tickets for the Old Town Trolley in Seaport Village which we did ($30 for adults and $15 for kids). This allowed us to see the town without having to get our car out of valet parking (which was $22 per day plus tips). Be careful if you choose to walk to little Italy or the pier from the hotel. That area can be a little dicey and there are a lot of homeless people hanging about. I realized this a little too late and ended up taking a bicycle taxi back. The pool was nice as was the fitness room. We ordered a large pizza from the restaurant one evening. It was good and came with 4 sodas for $16. A bargin meal for us. I would not stay at this particular Embassy Suites again until they remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Downtown...”
Reviews.Author: francisfammem
Reviews.Content: I'm a local, and stayed one night at the Embassy Suites (room 930-city view) after a holiday party. I found the staff to be very nice and helpful...after being billed ($22/day...no other option for on-site parking) for two cars at the hotel (which was our original plan, but ended up only taking one car) they removed the second car without any hesitation. The room was spacious and very clean. The beds were nice and comfortable. The tables and cabintry did have visible wear and tear. The breakfast and manager's reception were great! The valet guys were awesome...stood in the rain to hail us a taxi cab! The location was great for the Midway museum and Seaport Village!

Reviews.Title: “excellent family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wiztooth
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here while attending a meeting at the convention center. It was only a short, pleasant 10 minute walk to the convention center, and the closer hotels (Marriott, Hilton) don't offer the space that the Embassy Suites does - important when travelling wiht 2 small children. Location is great - within a short walk of the Midway and several other great boats which comprise a maritime museum. It was a very short ride to the zoo, Sea World, LegoLand (40 min.), and La Jolla. The indoor pool is small but functional, and my 3 1/2 y.o. daughter loved "feeding" the koi in the lobby streams. The free breakfast and evening coccktail hour are nice touches. The only negative is that the on-site seafood restaurant is decidedely mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: le-vieux-chien
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting, and very happy with the overall experience. Good rooms, good breakfast, good free drinks each evening. Excellent location, fantastic bay view. Valet parking a bit of a rip off, but even adding 22 dollars a day it is still very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Hotel exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Bernab
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. I had read a lot of reviews before finally deciding on this hotel. There were bad reviews and good reviews I had read and I was skeptical about choosing this hotel. I like to have all my options open and had actually reserved this hotel and the Hilton Gaslamp up until the day before and we decided on the Embassy Suites. I was still somewhat unsure of my decision but told myself to wait and see and keep an open mind. I was pleasantly surprised and the hotel was great. The hotel itself was nice and open and the front desk and bell staff were very friendly and accomodating. Our room was not ready upon arrival so they gladly secured our luggage so we could walk around the area. We arrived back after a few hours and rested in the lobby area before deciding where to go next as we did not expect our room to be ready yet. Just before I was about to ask the front desk how much longer until our room was ready, one of the bell man came up to me with our room keys in hand and told us we were all checked in and our room was ready. That was very nice and unexpected. The room was large and very clean. You could tell that this room had been recently updated with new carpets, new furniture, flat-screen TVs and bedding. We traveled with 2 teenagers and it was nice for them to have their own space in the living area with the fold out couch, which was comfortable enough. Our room with a king size bed was nice, the bed was comfortable and the bay view balcony was wonderful. If you get a room with a bay view, you don't hear the train noise very much. It was nice to have the refrigerator to be able to stock it with drinks and the microwave for bringing leftovers back to your room. The location was great for shopping and hanging out downtown, walking distance to the Horton mall and Seaport Village. It is also a nice walk to/from the Gaslamp area. A few times we took a $4 taxi ride to dinner downtown to save some time but otherwise walking the 15 minutes isn't so bad. The location is ideal for taking the trolley. There is a trolley stop one block away and the Plaza train station is a close walk also. We took the trolley one day to Tijuana and that was very easy, the trolley is also a fun way to get around even for a few blocks down to the ball park or convention center. The breakfast was very good and convenient each morning. It was nice to be able to wake up and eat breakfast right away without having to get ready and make decisions on where to eat. The food was good and plentiful and the service was excellent. The teenagers enjoyed being able to get their own coffee drinks and eat what they wanted. This is a very nice perk at the hotel. All in all we were very pleased with this hotel during our 3 day stay, I'm glad I decided to try this hotel - the location was great, the rooms were new, clean and large, the service was good and the breakfast was an added plus. I would recommend staying at this hotel to anyone who likes seeing the sights, nightlife downtown and staying at a comfortable hotel which is not overly priced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value, Dishonest front desk personnel”
Reviews.Author: gumdoc45
Reviews.Content: Overall this property is fairly well run. The free breakfast in the morning is adequate and the conceirge is very helpful. Rooms are what you would expect at an Embassy Suites. We did have one issue with the front desk. Someone in our party needed an item laundered. The front desk person told her it was $20 and proceeded to take a $20 bill from her. The next day when checking out the $20 was not credited to the account, it seems that someone procured themselves a $20 tip. To be sure, we should have gotten a receipt, nonetheless, dishonesty was at work here. The folks at the front desk the following day were apologetic, but there was nothing that they could do. The person in our party had not gotten a name and we were in a rush to catch a plane. That aside I have no other critiques of the hotel, however, I would probably try the Hyatt across the street next time. It looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A sad worn-out property”
Reviews.Author: FL450
Reviews.Content: A below-par Embassy Suites property. When we asked if we had the best room the staff confessed that the rooms were being renovated and that the best rooms were at the lower floors and had already been booked by a large group. When we asked if this was the BEST Hilton property in San Diego, they had no idea. This property has recently been sold and it is apparent that the prior owner did no preventative maintenance. The rooms are sparsely furnished, dated, and in dire need of renewal. This review would not be so scathing if the rooms were not $279, but for $320 you can get a really nice (allbeit single room) accomodation at the new Omni (where we moved). If you want to see what an Embassy Suites shoud be try Albuquerque or Dallas. This is worth about $125, no more.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites - Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Philly3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites the last week of August for 5 nights. Overall, it did not wow us - it was just okay and a decent value for the money. We liked the space that having a suite provided, but the room and bathroom were really in serious need of updating. We had a bay view and during two nights of our stay, we saw a huge fireworks display from a barge right outside our window - a nice surprise. The breakfast was great, but the cocktail hour was pretty weak. Bargain brand choices for drinks and potato chips as the snack. The valet parking worked out fine; our car was always waiting for us after we called ahead. Our toilet broke twice and both times maintenance responded quickly. We asked advice from two different concierges and got bad advice from both. One gave us a terrible restaurant recommendation (Harbor House in Seaporte Village) and the other consierge was very negative on two occasions about some of the things we wanted to do (all tourist destinations). We decided to ignore him and had a great time doing what we wanted to do. One of the biggest downfalls of this hotel is no outdoor pool area. That is hard to believe in a city with such perfect weather. We had a fabulous dinner at The Top of the Market at the Fish Market. It is about a 10 minute walk across the street, next to the USS Midway. The location is convenient to everything, but next time, we will likely try someplace that is updated with more amenities and an outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: SOMA_nomad
Reviews.Content: I rarely say never, but I will NEVER STAY AT THIS EMBASSY SUITES EVER AGAIN! Positives - Food service was very courteous and efficient. Valet service was also very good and always offered driving directions. Negatives - We had loud and drunks next door. All security did was to hush them back into their suite. As the noise continued, I called the front desk @ 3:30 AM to complain and security never took care of the problem. The loud and drunk female visitor (not even a hotel guest) finally left @ 6AM. The previous guest (June '06) was right about the trains. We were on the 10th floor and our balcony faced the Grand Hyatt and Seaport Village, but the LOUD train came by late at night and early in the morning during our entire three nights stay. We were also charged for a movie that we never watched. The desk clerk indicated that we watched 28 minutes of the movie and she could not take the charge off of our bill. Upon check-in, the desk clerk told us that, as hotel guest, we would receive a 10% discount at the onsite restaurant. We ate there twice, and charged it to our room, but the discount was not applied to our final hotel bill. My wife called and the desk clerk said that she could not amend the discount to our bill, but would offset it by removing one of the daily valet charges. Upon checkout, another desk clerk said that there was no mention of removing the valet charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katpaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Aug. 14 to Aug. 17. We enjoyed it very much. The location is great--by the bay. The rooms were clean and big. Had two TVs, microwave, refrigerator. Free breakfast and plenty to eat. We would definately stay there again. Make sure you see in San Diego: take a harbor cruise, go to Coronado Island and Seaport Village. Weather is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlphaRiss
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 4 nights while my husband attended a conference in downtown. When we travel with the kids, we usually opt to stay at an Embassy Suites because they are typically set up to comfortably accomodate families, from the layout of their suites to the complimentary breakfasts. The Embassy Suites in Downtown San Diego was no exception. We enjoyed our stay here. The staff were all friendly and professional; the concierge, in particular, was very helpful in giving us ideas for restaurants and places to visit. The way the the hotel is laid out is also a big plus: all the rooms open up to the atrium - you don't have to go thru any dark hallways to get to your room. The only drawback for us was that there weren't very many decent restaurants within short walking distance (we weren't impressed with any at the Seaport Village across the street); both Horton Plaza and the Gaslight district are about a 15-20 min walk from the hotel, but having 2 kids, it's not a journey that I'd like to make at night. The onsite restaurant, the Pacific Fish Company was a disappointment. There are 2 separate parts of the restaurant, housed across the hall from each other - one side is the casual sushi/sports bar and the other is a full-service restaurant. We ate at the full-service one. I think we would've been better off eating in the more casual sports bar (I believe that the menus are slightly different). We weren't impressed with any of the dishes that we ordered -they were bland, not to mention overpriced for what you get. The wait staff, although earnest, got a couple of our orders wrong. Truth be told, we enjoyed the food at the complimentary breakfast buffet better. Despite the restaurant misses, if we make another trip to San Diego, we will more than likely stay at the Embassy Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as 3 yrs ago- train whistles by at 2AM!!!”
Reviews.Author: 78traveler
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 3 nights at the Embassy Suites at the San Diego- Downtown. I stayed at this hotel 3 yrs ago for a conference at the convention center and I loved it! So when I went back to San Diego for vacation this year I figured I might as well stay where I knew I had a good room. The room was nice, although it wasn't as nice as remember last time, the bathroom lighting wasn't that great, infact I found the bathroom to be pretty dark. The bed was very comfortable, however it was hard to get a good nights sleep when a freight train whistled by at 2AM the first night!! Then 11PM the two following nights. Our city view room was one of the few with a balcony so I am sure that made the sound even more intense since we had sliding glass doors. When I complained to the front desk they told me that I shouldn't hear the train because I was on the 9th floor!!! YEA RIGHT!! I felt like the train was next to me, I could even see it from my room when I looked out at the train tracks and since it crosses over a lot of streets when it come through downtown it whistled a lot! All in all the room was a good deal because you get a suite and a full breakfast. The $22 to valet the car (the only choice) wasn't as pricey as other downtown hotels. And the ability to walk to the marina and the shops was really nice. With the full breakfast we were able to fill up in the morning and then just get a late lunch- early dinner, so that was nice. If you are going to stay at the Embassy Suites ask for a marina view room, that way you probably won't hear the train.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience...lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: msucheer
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week long stay at the Embassy Suites downtown and I couldn't have picked a better place to stay for the value. What a wonderful location - right across the street from Seaport Village and just a $4 cab ride away from the Gaslamp. I actually even walked back one day. Of course, anyone who has stayed at an Embassy before knows that their breakfasts are incredible and this one didn't disappoint. The rooms were typical, but, it is SO nice to have the extra sitting room, especially on extended stays. I was able to go in the sitting room and get ready in the morning without waking my husband. I really enjoyed the restaurant downstairs - wonderful sushi! I had it 3 nights out of my stay and the bar had a great local feel to it. Staff was courteous and I had a great time here!

Reviews.Title: “It's the service which counts!”
Reviews.Author: M-man11
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room over the hotel's own web site and secured a discounted rate provided that we prepay in full--no changes or refunds. We had our own "reservations" about this ploy but were glad we made them because when we checked in, the hotel was fully booked. Three days before our visit, the hotel concierge telephoned not only to confirm our reservation but to inquire whether there was anything she might do. Being a Hilton Honors member paid off here! In addition, our room was ready when we checked in at 2:30 (normal check-in is at 4:00). Although there is a $22 parking fee, the in and out privileges and the promptness/courtesy iof the valet staff more than compensated. In fact, when we first arrived, Albert promptly escorted us and our bags to the front desk and within minutes we were looking at the bay and Coronado Bridge. Wonderful! Drinks at 5:30--7:30 with accompanying niblets. The Greek Taverna, enthusiastically recommended by our Concierge turned out to be OK--tentative service but good drinks and wines available. Mopussaka was so-so (bland) but the lamb was excellent. Enough to bring back to the hotel to warm up for lunch! Breakfast was quite good. True, the orange juice must be poured into styrofoam containers and the coffee mugs are plastic, but this prevents broken glass and theft. An outstanding addition to the breakfast scene was the cappuccino machine with latte, hot chocolate, and of course cappuccino. The area was well maintained with pleasant staff constantly cleaning and replacing food. New flat screen TVs were welcome although a CD system would have been nice. A final note: driving in downtown San Diego is a breeze compared to anywhere in the North Bay. Also, our concierge meticulously mapped out directions for negotiating exits and locations. A job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Went with Small Expectations, but Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCT
Reviews.Content: This was one of our nicer Embassy Suites experiences. Conveniently located for sightseeing; reasonably fresh room decor and comfortable beds; very helpful staff; free shuttle from airport and to cruise ship, which added value; usual economical breakfast buffet . . . but all in all, great value for the money and a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, great location, super view!”
Reviews.Author: oldnavy61
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed in the Embassy for 1 night (Friday 3/31) We arrived at the hotel at 10:30 am. We would not have expected our room to be ready, so we pre checked in. I was using my hilton honors points so the room was supposed to be a city view lower level. at check-in we we told that we had been upgraded to a bay view upper floor--the kids (and myself) were thrilled) We checked our luggage in with no issues. plus with the attached starbucks we reenergized before going out to explore. the hotel location is great. if you were a light packer and the weather was good you could walk (about 2 miles) to the airport. and it would be a nice walk! you are close to the maritime muesuem, the midway, seaport village, gas light quarter, the ferry to coranado. We we finally got to the room later that afternoon the room was clean and not "worn-out" as in previous threads. we had a corner room with a king.. for some great reason my kids don't mind sleeping on the pull-out...in the PM there is a mngrs cocktail hour very nice with free drinks and snacks. Breakfast was not as good as I've had with other embassy's I suggest you order eggs iinstead of the precooked--then you know they will be hot. We had not picked up our rental at the airport yet (would be later in the pm) so we rechecked our luggage again. when we were ready around 4pm we pick-up our luggage and the hotel shuttle delivered us to the hertz office at the airport. overall we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Family!”
Reviews.Author: KearneyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites over President's Day and everyone loved the hotel. The room was a great size for a family, and two tv's helped with the children. The location is perfect for seeing Seaport Village, the USS Midway and the Embarcadero. The breakfast was excellent, cooked to order eggs/omelettes, and the usual cereals, fruit, juices. You could either wait for them to cook for you or they also had an express line of precooked eggs, toast, hashbrowns, etc. The evening manager's reception was also night with a good variety of chips, popcorn, etc. The adults in our party liked the free drinks, while the kids liked the sodas and the BIG bowl of cherries to make cherry cokes, etc. We ate in the restaurant (Pacific Fish Co.)one night and it was good and moderately priced. The kids loved the turtles and fish that live in the lobby. We will definitely go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: greenberry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night and were extremely pleased with the location and service we received. We arrived at noon and asked if we could store our luggage and return our rental car - not only did they let us park in the valet area for half an hour to unload our car, but they also had a room ready so we got to settle in well before the posted check-in time. We returned our car and had them come pick us up with their airport shuttle and that worked out perfectly (plus it saved us the $22 parking fee). Hotel is beautiful, especially the lobby area. We were pleasantly surprised by the full bar for the cocktail hour in the evening! Every staff member we met was extremely helpful and friendly, from the front desk to the cleaning crew. We walked to Seaport Harbor and to the Gaslamp Quarter - hotel is in a very good location, right across the street from Seaport. Complimentary breakfast was outstanding, with plenty of choices for any type of appetite. Our only complaint is that we didn't get to stay another night!

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites San Diego Bay - Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 601 Pacific Highway, San Diego, CA 92101
